loan.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 26-year-old married lady and has three children. Her husband Ayman works abroad for an electrical installation company.
Iman was motivated by her passion for sewing and fashion to start up a small business at home, so she bought a sewing machine and started to design and sell clothes a year ago.
Now she is applying for this loan to buy a new sewing machine since the one she has now is old and slow.
"Iman is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her Sister Samira appears in the photo.

loan.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy and to produce shoes for his business

loan.name: Natercia Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Natercia da Conceicao T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provncia de mesmo nome, sul de Moambique casada me de 3 filhos de idades entre 05 a 18 anos, os mais velhos continuam a estudar. Fez somente 9 classe no continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e no sustenta mais ningum.
Saiu de Maputo para Boane com a sua familia quando concluiram a nova residencia, tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 5 anos. No possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.500.00mt por ms que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de suas amigas que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu quinto emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, amendoim, acucar, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 8.300.00, 10.450.00, 12.000.00 e 15.000.00mt para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para ampliar a sua banca.
texts.en:
Natercia da Conceicao T. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, ages 5 to 18. The elder children are still in school. Natercia only finished ninth grade and did not continue due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.
She left Maputo to move to Boane with her family when they finished building their new home. She has had her own business for more than five years. She has no employees and has a monthly income of 5,500 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).
She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are customers of this institution. This is Natercia's fifth loan with Hluvuku, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth and other items) to increase the amount of stock she has. The previous loans were for 8,300 meticais, 10,450 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were for the business.
She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for other loans to expand her sales stand.

loan.use: to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc.)

loan.name: Kiburara Tweheyo Group

texts.en:
44-year-old K. Mary has been partial to farming since 2001. Mary says, to take root in this worthwhile business, she relied on money from a small goat sales business. The happy-go-lucky mother of three practices her farming in Kiburara-Ibanda.
To open better horizons for her business, her stocks in trade have been diligence, determination, good human relationship skills and prayer. She says she has been able to make strides in terms of better profits and the provision of better welfare for her family because of this business.
Mary says her future plans are for the expansion of her farming gardens where she has for the most part been planting, harvesting, and selling bananas, cassava, cabbages, beans, rice and pumpkins. Weekly she says this business generates shillings 50,000 as profit. She says with this loan she is going to pay school fees for her kids.

loan.use: to pay school fees for her kids.

loan.name: Ana Inguane

texts.pt:
Ana Inguane T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provncia de Maputo, sul de Moambique casada me de 9 filhos dos quais ja nao se recorda das idades. alguns continuam a estudar. Nao teve formacao academica porque os pais nao dipunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e sustenta alguns netos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Matola para Boane com a sua familia ha bastante tempo procurando melhores condicoes de vida, tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 20 anos que desensevolve com ajuda de uma das filhas. No possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt por ms que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de suas amigas que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu sexto emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, refrescos, amendoim, acucar, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.600.00, 6.000.00, 10.000.00, 13.000.00 e 22.000.00mt aplicados para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial no seu quintal.
texts.en:
Ana Inguane T. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is a married mother of 9 children whose ages she no longer remembers. Some of them are still in school. She did not attend school because her parents did not have the financial resources. She lives in her own home with her family, and she also supports some of her grandchildren who live with her.
She left Matola for Boane with her family many years ago in search of better living conditions. She has had her own business for more than 20 years, which she runs with the help of one of her daughters. She does not have any employees and she earns 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses. She saves part of her earnings through Xitique, a traditional system of rotating savings.
She has never had loans in other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her friends who are also clients. This loan for 21,000.00mt is her sixth with Hluvuku, which she will use to purchase products (fish, soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc.) to increase her inventory. Her previous loans were for 6.600.00, 6.000.00, 10.000.00, 13.000.00 and 22.000.00mt, which were used for her business.
She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to additional loans in the future. She plans to request new loans to build a shop on her property.

loan.use: to purchase products (fish, soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc. )

loan.name: Alymkul's Group

texts.en:
Alymkul K., 51, is the leader of this group. Just like many other residents of Kochkor, Alymkul is engaged in agriculture. The entire family tries to help her out in finding better and better techniques for ploughing, watering and cultivating land. Her husband has been a member of a local farming community for a long time. He is a skilled technician and always knows how to use the right technology for the right kind of product.
The family raises agricultural products starting from grains and berries, but also rare kinds of vegetables. Several years ago Alymkul managed to save a small amount to purchase electrical appliances for the house. The initial capital, invested nineteen years ago, was not in vain, since nowadays a monthly income from wholesaling vegetables reaches 5,000 soms.
Alymkul says the equipment needed for field work is getting exhausted and is out of order, therefore she gathered this group and applied for a loan from Kiva. The requested loan will be spent on fuels and lubricants and food processing.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase fuel and lubricants and do food processing.

loan.name: Audencia Zaqueu

texts.pt:
Audencia Zaqueu M. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Provncia de mesmo nome, sul de Moambique solteira e me de 2 filhos de 22 e 25 anos de idade todos ainda vao a escola. Fez somente 6 classe nao continuou porque os pais nao tinham condicoes financeiras para ela continuar. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio em sua casa e desenvolve ha mais de 6 anos. No possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 6.000.00mt a 7.000.00mt por ms que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de seus amigos que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu segundo emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Guarda fatos, mesa, cadeiras, estantes, comodas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. O emprestimo anterior foi de 15.000.00 e foi aplicado para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para construir um salao de cabeleirero e uma banca comercial.
texts.en:
Audencia Zaqueu M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is a single mother of two children ages 22 and 25, who are still in school. She only completed school through the sixth grade because her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.
She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo. She has had her own business out of her home for more than 6 years. She does not have any employees and she earns around 6.000.00mt to 7.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some of her monthly earnings in her bank account.
Audencia has never had loans in other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, for 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.) to increase her inventory. Her prior loan was for 15.000.00 and was used for her business.
She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future. She plans to request new loans to build a hair salon and a bank.

loan.use: to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.).

loan.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: Shuhrat Y. lives in Shahrituz. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has been working in animal husbandry for three years. He primarily fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loan.use: to buy livestock

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more plastic bowls, baskets, baby bathtubs, and other plastic utensils.

loan.name: Luisa Isaias

texts.pt:
Luisa Isaias N. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Provncia de mesmo nome, sul de Moambique casada. Fez somente 3 classe nao continuou porque os pais nao a deixaram continuar. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane quando se casou, tem um negocio proprio que desenvolve ha mais de 26 anos. No possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 3.000.00mt e conta com ajuda do marido que tem a pensao da companhia Industrial este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de conversa com suas amigas que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu terceiro emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo alimentar, arroz, sabao, feijao e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00 e 10.000.00 e ambos foram aplicados para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial para deixar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Luisa Isaias N. was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. She is married. She only completed school through the 3rd grade because her parents did not allow her to continue. She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.
She left Maputo for Boane when she got married. She has had her own business for more than 26 years. She does not have any employees and earns about 3.000.00mt per month. She has help from her husband who receives a pension from an industrial company. The money covers household expenses and she saves some monthly in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a conversation with friends who are also clients of the organization. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt. She will use the loan to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.) to increase her inventory. Her prior loans were for 7.000.00 and 10.000.00, both of which were used for her business.
She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future. She plans to request new loans to build a shop and no longer sell her products in the streets.

loan.use: to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.)

loan.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa Berth est homme mari de 31 ans et pre de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni, prfecture de Bougouni (Rgion de Sikasso). Monsieur Moussa Berth a frquent lcole moderne jusquen classe de 10 me anne (Systme ducatif Malien), quil abandonna au profit des activits gnratrices de revenus et cela cause des difficults dans sa famille. Il tenta pendant des annes diffrentes activits, mais sans succs, en raison surtout de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Il finit par apprendre auprs de son oncle la vente darticles divers de boutique. Avec une exprience de 5 ans, il matrise son activit. Sa boutique est situe dans le quartier Torakabougou. Pour renforcer son activit, il dcide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour obtenir un prt afin dacheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il sapprovisionne Bamako (Capitale de Rpublique du Mali) et parfois Bougouni auprs des grossistes. Il est sa premire exprience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Sa clientle est compose de la population locale. Il compte raliser un bnfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA, qui sera utilis pour agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Berth is a 31-year-old married man and father of two children. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in the Torakabougou district of the city of Bougouni, prefecture of Bougouni (region of Sikasso).
Mr. Moussa Berth attended modern school up to the 10th grade (Malian educational system). He quit school to start earning a living due to his family experiencing difficulties. Over the years, he attempted various activities without success, mainly due to a lack of sufficient working capital.
He eventually learned the business of selling sundries from his uncle. With five years of experience, he now has a good command of his activity. His shop is located in the district of Torakabougou.
To strengthen its business, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for a loan to purchase various merchandise for his shop. He gets his stock from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sometimes in Bougouni as well. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. His clientele consists of local people.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which he will use to expand his shop.

loan.use: to purchase merchandise for his sundries shop

loan.name: Casimiro Nhamuge

texts.pt:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provncia de Gaza, sul de Moambique solteiro. Fez somente 2 classe nao continuou porque os pais nao dispunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e sustenta 4 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo devido a guerra e veio com a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade que desenvolve ha mais de 20 anos. No possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de conversa com amigos que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu terceiro emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sabao, feijao, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 9.000.00mt ambos e para o comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial de raiz como forma de melhorar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique, and he is single. He only finished second grade and did not continue with school because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and supports four relatives (nephews and/or nieces) who live with him.
He left Gaza to move to Maputo because of the war, and he came here with his family. For more than 20 years he has had his own business selling staple goods. Casimiro has no employees and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).
Casimiro has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku by talking with friends who are customers of this institution. This is his third Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were both for 9,000 meticais and were for the business.
He promises to make his payments on time so he can take out more loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to build a brand-new store as a way of improving his business.

loan.use: to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts, etc.)

loan.name: Sop Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarit SOP MOHAMED est cr le 27 aot 2009. Il est compos de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du mme quartier. Elles ont mont leur groupe par voisinage et par liens d'affinit. Le groupe fait du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3
Madame KATY C. (debout droite de la photo en tee-shirt jaune) est responsable du groupe. Elle est ge de 40 ans. Elle est marie et mre de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confis par des proches.
Elle fait un petit commerce de vtements et de parfums. Elle pratique cette activit avant qu'elle n'adhre au Banc Villageois
Son nouveau crdit lui permettra d'aller la capitale (Dakar) pour s'approvisionner en marchandises (vtements et parfums)
Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille (nourriture, sant, scolarit des enfants etc.)
texts.en:
The SOP MOHAMED solidarity group was created August 27, 2009. It is composed of eleven women who are all from the same neighborhood. They came together as neighbors and through bonds of affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MONTAGNE NORD3.
Mrs. Katy C. (standing on the right and wearing a yellow shirt) is the head of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two (2) children. She is also responsible for two other children who were entrusted to her by relatives. She has a small business selling clothes and perfumes, an activity she was already engaged in prior to joining the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will allow her to go to the capital (Dakar) to stock up on merchandise (clothing and perfume). Her goal is to help her husband in supporting the family (food, health care, children's tuition, etc.)

loan.use: to buy clothing and perfume for resale

loan.name: Ana Joaquim

texts.pt:
Ana Joaquim M. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Provncia de Inhambane, sul de Moambique separada mae de 2 filhos de 09 e 13 anos todos ainda continuam a estudar. Fez somente 6 classe nao continuou porque os pais nao dispunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa prpria com a sua famlia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em casa do seu irmao a busca de melhores condicoes de vida. Trabalha numa empresa de producao e venda de Banana no Distrito de Boane ha mais de 9 anos, e recebe um salario de 1.690.00mt por mes e 850.00mt provenientes do seu negocio aplica nas despasas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).
Nunca teve emprstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravs de conversa com colegas que so clientes desta instituio. Este o seu primeiro emprstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao ( chapas de zinco, cimento, arros de porta e outros) para continuar com a construcao da sua casa.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros crditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos emprstimos para concluir a sua casa para poder albergar familiares que se encontram na sua terra natal e ampliar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Joaquim M. was born in Massinga District, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is separated and has two children, ages 9 and 13. Both children are still in school. Ana only finished sixth grade and did not continue with school because her parents could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.
She left Inhambane to move to her brother's house in Maputo in search of better living conditions. For more than nine years she has worked in a banana production and sales company in Boane District. She receives a salary of 1,690 meticais per month and earns 850 meticais from her own business. Ana uses this money for household expenses and is able to save some through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).
She has never had loans with other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku by talking with coworkers who are customers of this institution. This is Ana's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 9,000 meticais to buy construction material (zinc sheets, cement, door frames and other items) to continue construction on her house.
She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for more loans to finish her house so she can house relatives from her hometown, and she plans to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy construction material (zinc sheets, cement, door frames, etc.)

loan.name: Katty

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Katty K.. She is a widow and has one child aged 17. In 2007, Katty established her plastic slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she realised that it was necessary that she also become productive in her marital home. Her business is open 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.
Katty would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Katty requires a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of plastic slippers and sandals for her business. "Now that I have lost my husband and I do not have anyone to help me support my child, my business is the only solution to my problems," said Katty. "I wish to see my child through her education."
Katty thanks you for your support.

loan.use: To buy more plastic slippers and sandals.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Grace W. G. has been supplying building materials to her customers in Mwiki town .She is 49 years old, widowed and a mother of four children. Her monthly income is KES.45,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, who is registered member with KADET, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 to buy more building stones for sale .The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children and expand her business by starting a milk bar.
In future she desires to grow her business and buy a deep freezer for the milk business.

loan.use: To buy building stones for resale.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is a married mother of a 15-year-old son, and she lives with her family in Mariakani, Coast province. Grace is a retail business-lady and has operated a retail shop for seven years. It has been a success.
This marks Graces third time borrowing from KADET LTD and with this new loan she plans to add more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks. Grace has been using her income to expand her business and in repaying back the previous loan and she hopes to do the same with the anticipated profits from her shop.
She hopes to expand her shop even further and later diversify to other businesses.

loan.use: to buy more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase various items

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy bed sheets for resale

loan.name: Mahudjro- Kadjacome Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUDJRO- KADJACOME est form de quatre personnes qui habitent toutes dans le mme quartier Lokokoukoum (dans la commune de Sm-Podji). La reprsentante de ce groupe, nomme Snoum Antoinette, est celle dont la main est leve sur la photo. Cest la sixime fois que ce groupe sollicite lappui financier de ALID en vue dlever le niveau de leur activit. Snoum Antoinette est marie un dmarcheur du nom de Hubert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolariss et vivant leur charge. Snoum Antoinette habite Lokokoukoum avec ses enfants et son mari depuis sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a prs de cinq ans que Snoum Antoinette mne comme activit la vente de friperies de faon ambulante. Paralllement cette activit, Snoum Antoinette vend des beignets. Dans le but de renforcer son activit et de mieux rpondre la demande de sa clientle, Snoum Antoinette dsire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec ses autres membres.
texts.en:
The MAHUDJRO-KADJACOME group consists of four people who all live in the same district in Lokokoukoum (in the town of Sm-Podji). The groups representative is Snoum Antoinette, seen in the photo with her hand raised. The group is seeking financial support from ALID for the sixth time to bolster their activities.
Snoum Antoinette is married to a door-to-door salesman named Hubert. The couple have three dependent children who all attend school. Snoum Antoinette has been living in Lokokoukoum for seven years with her husband and children. The couple handle together the various family expenses. Snoum Antoinette has been selling used clothing door to door for nearly five years. She also sells beignets as a secondary activity.
In order to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand, Snoum Antoinette is seeking a new loan along with the other group members.

loan.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loan.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Fatu K.. She is married and has three children who are all independent and are employed. She has three dependents, who are children of relatives that live in a village where educational facilities are very poor. They live with her instead so they can get a good education.
In 1980, Fatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband to give adequate support to their children. She opens her business six days a week for nine hours a day.
She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). Fatu requires a loan in order to buy poplin, lace, bail wax, cotton and khaki materials. As with her own children, Fatu wishes to see her dependants through their education. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to buy poplin, lace, bail wax, cotton and khaki materials

loan.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni sells tea and bread. She is 28 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Poni took out a loan to stock more tea and bread to sell. She hopes to pay her child's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loan.use: to stock more tea and bread to sell.

loan.name: Aniyali Amanyi Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca, 36, has been engaged in a stone quarry business venture the last four years. Such a business requires an awful lot of elbow grease and most times many people associate it with only men. Rebecca, a mother to two, has however taken it upon herself to manifest that even women can succeed in a male-dominated business. She and her laborers operate from Kikonge in Mityana.
She says she was introduced to this business by a close friend and she says she is able to make profits to the tune of 80,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) a week. She says with this loan she is going to purchase more hammers to be used in the quarry. At the time the photo was being taken, two group members were not present and are marked as unpictured. One other lady in the photo had her face a little bit obscured and is also marked as unpictured.

loan.use: to buy more hammers to be used in the quarry

loan.name: Rwensinga Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Jane is the leader of Rwensinga Twimukye group, Ibanda. She is 42 years old and married with children. Jane has a grocery store in Rwensinga trading centre where she sells yellow bananas, tomatoes, and so on. She sells from the side of the road near a school and restaurants. She is able to make 50,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) as weekly profits and in addition, she has a produce selling business and a retail shop.
She works with one of her children and she is happy that she can collect their school fees with the help of her husband. She has been using loans from Pearl Microfinance for over four years now and her life has greatly improved. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for resale.

loan.use: to buy more stock for resale.

loan.name: Gdon Plus Group

texts.en:
Gdon Plus is a Community Bank made up of 11 micro entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Lola Y.. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.
Lola is 55 years old and single. She has been in business since 2002. She originally ran a restaurant. Today she sells lamp oil at her place located east of the city of Kinshasa. She likes her business because it allows her to become financially independent and has stabilized her family economically.
Lola has been a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing more oil in bulk. She will resell it with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50. Lola has three children between 8 and 34 years old. Two of them attend school. Her ambition is to open an oil storage facility.

loan.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying more lamp oil and reselling it at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard S. W. is 41 years old, married, and a father of four wonderful children. They live in Kitale town. Benard sells newspapers and magazines there and has been doing this business for thirteen years. He earns a monthly income of forty-eight thousand shillings.
This will be Benard's first loan from KADET LTD., and he wants to use the entire loan to add new stock to his business. He would like to buy new magazines, newspapers etc,. With the income, he will repay the loan and also expand his business.
In the future, Benard wants to educate his children to the highest level, also to expand and start another business.

loan.use: To buy more stock, like magazines

loan.name: William

texts.en: William J. is currently in a business of selling sugar. She is 42 years old and married, with 5 children, all of whom go to school. She has requested a loan to stock more sugar to sell. With extra profits from her business, she hopes to build a house for renting in the future .

loan.use: to stock more sugar to sell.

loan.name: Monica Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. Mnica tiene 26 aos de edad es conviviente tiene 2 hijos menores de 8 y 2 aos de edad, vive en casa de su suegra desde hace 8 aos, ya que su vivienda aun no esta construida,su cnyuge trabaja como operario en construccin, Monica se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora desde hace 2 aos ella como toda joven tiene sueos y metas y uno de ellos es poder tener su propio puesto de ropa, Con el dinero surtira su mercadera por cambio de estacin.
texts.en:
26-year old Sra. Mnica has lived with her partner and their two children aged 8 and 2 in her mother-in-laws house for eight years as her own house is not yet built. Her partner works in construction.
Mnica has been selling clothing door-to-door for the last two years. Ever since she was a young girl, she has had dreams and goals. One of them is to own a clothing stall. With the loan she plans buy new stock appropriate for the time of year.

loan.use: to buy new stock appropriate for the time of year

loan.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 01 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 01 est compos D. 17 membres qui vivent tous dans le mme quartier. La prsidente D. ce groupement, du nom D. Marie Thrse, est celle ayant une main leve sur la photo. Dans le but D. rehausser le niveau D. leur activit afin D. mieux faire face la demanD. D. leur clientle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxime fois l'appui financier D. ALID. Marie Thrse est marie un certain Pauline et a six enfants, tous scolariss. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a une dizaine danne que Marie Thrse et son mari se sont installs Abatin, un quartier D. Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Marie Thrse nest jamais alle lcole. Pour subvenir ses besoins et ceux D. sa famille, Marie Thrse mne comme activit depuis dix ans environs, la vente D. produits vivriers par le systme D. distribution. C'est Z et Ikpinl que Marie Thrse s'approvisionne. Dans le but D. renforcer son activit et D. mieux satisfaire sa clientle, Marie Thrse sollicite un crdit auprs D. ALID. Son ambition est damener son activit un niveau plus lev.
texts.en:
GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA group is composed of 17 members who live in the same neighborhood. The group leader, Marie Thrse, is raising her hand in the photograph. In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the group is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALID.
Marie Thrse is married to Paulin, and she has six children who all attend school. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together. About ten years ago, the couple moved in to Abatin, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bnin.
Marie Thrse never attended school. For ten years, she's been selling food products through the distribution system, in order to proviD. for herself and her family. She gets her supplies in Z and Ikpinl. In order to bolster her business and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan from ALID. Her ambition is to take her business to a higher level.

loan.use: to buy food products

loan.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La seora Mara del Carmen Snchez Torres, vive en la localidad de ngel Alvino Corzo, un lugar muy bonito donde su gente es muy popular. Ella vive en unin libre con el seor Jose Trinidad Meja Gmez y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun estn a su responsabilidad: Guadalupe, Gabriela y el ms pequeo es Jos Arturo. Solicito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo de la marca Andrea y Terra, en donde lleva un ao y cuatro meses de lo que nos cometa que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos. Para dedicarse a esta actividad la inspiro su esposo para as desarrollarse en sus gastos econmicos. Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo ahorra para comprar ms zapatos y tenga lo suficiente para que su clientela obtenga lo que desea comprar a su gusto. Su ms grande deseo es que con la ayuda de dios y el prstamo logre comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa ms grande, as podr vivir mas cmoda con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Maria del Carmen Snchez Torres lives in the ngel Alvino Corzo town, a very beautiful place with many people. She is in a common-law marriage with Mr. Jose Trinidad Meja Gmez, with whom she has three children who are under their care: Guadalupe, Gabriela, and the youngest, Jose Arturo. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes from the Andrea y Terra catalogue. She has been doing this for one year and four months, and she tells us that it is going well and she has made a good income. Her husband inspired her to do this work in order to contribute to the household costs.
She saves her income to buy more shoes in order to have enough that her customers can obtain what they most want to buy.
Her greatest wish is that, with the help of God and this loan, she will be able to buy a plot of land to build a bigger home, in order to be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loan.use: to pay for the purchase of shoes from a catalogue

loan.name: Perine

texts.en: Perine is 28 years old. She has 2 children who are 7 and 5 years old, and they are both in school. Perine owns a general store in which she sells rice, sugar and cooking oil. She has been running this store for 3 years with her husband. This has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more rice and sugar. With the profits, she hopes to save as much as possible so that she can renovate her house.

loan.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Stock more Cosmetics.

loan.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald S. W. is a 27 year-old man and is married and a father of three children. They live in Matisi in the outskirts of Kitale. He makes molasses and sells to his customers in the same area. He has been in this business for eight years now, and he gets a monthly income of KES.30,000.
This will be Ronalds first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to buy three tanks of molasses for sale. With the income, he will buy a plot of land.
In the future, he wants to provide for his family and also expand his business.

loan.use: to buy three tanks of molasses

loan.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.en:
Auguy is the chairman of a Community Bank named Winner Plus which is composed of 12 members. These entrepreneurs are united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Auguy is 39 years old and single. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2005. He runs a cellphone booth and has a money changer business in the southwest of Kinshasa. He works hard to gain good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business brings in $105 per week.
Auguy is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having received and successfully repaid four previous loans. With this new loan, he will increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing phone accessories to resell at a profit. Auguy is very happy to be part of Hopes groups because it will help him achieve his dreams.

loan.use: increase his inventory of phone accessories

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Amirabeth

texts.es:
La seora Amirabeth Snchez Gmez, es originaria de ngel Albino Corzo, es casada con el seor Ferneli Velasco zenteno, con quien tiene dos hijos que a un estn a su responsabilidad y son: Juan Carlos y Jess.
Solicito el prstamo en fundacin para invertirlo en la compra y venta de carnes de res y cerdo, ya que para aliarlo (destazarlo), tiene que pagar personas que la poyen, aun as cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se encarga de vender en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad.
Con esta actividad comenz desde que se caso ya cuando sus hijos nacieron los gastos se incrementaron. Doa Amirabeth desea que con este prstamo pueda seguir trabajando as comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar y tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Amirabeth Snchez Gmez, lives in ngel Albino Corzo, and is married to Sr. Ferneli Velasco Zenteno. They have two sons still in their care, Juan Carlos and Jess.
She requests the loan from FRAC in order to invest it in buying and selling beef and pork, since in order to dress the meat (prepare the cuts) she has to pay the people who help her. She also has help from her husband, who is in charge of selling in the communities around where they live.
She started this work after her marriage, but when her sons were born, their expenses increased. Doa Amirabeth hopes that with this loan she can continue working so she can purchase some things they don't have for their home and have a better quality of life.

loan.use: to pay for beef and pork, dress it (prepare the cuts), and then sell it.

loan.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino C. is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 17 and 19 years old. The elder son is a high school student and the younger one goes to school. Nino and her family live in Lechuri village in Telavi district.
Nino has a grocery shop in the village. The shop is small but they have quite a good assortment of products. Ninos husband is a joiner and he makes bee hives and frames for the bee hives. The family has 51 bee hives with bee families. All bee hives were constructed by Ninos husband. The gathered honey is sold locally. The total income of the family is 900 laris per month.
With the requested loan, Nino and her husband plan to cultivate a plot of the land (1 ha) and sow maize. The harvested corn will be sold locally. The income from this activity will be used for further expansion of their grocery shop and the beekeeping business.

loan.use: to purchase materials for cultivating her land.

loan.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
La seora Mara Nieves A. Jimnez, vive en el municipio de Copainala estado de Chiapas Mxico, es madre soltera con un hijo su responsabilidad de nombre Erik de diecisiete aos de edad.
Ella solicito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, verduras, tortilla, entre otros, para la elaboracin de comidas y luego venderlo en la miasma localidad, con esto lleva diecisiete aos y comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos a sacado adelante a su nico hijo.
Su motivo a realizar esta actividad fue por si solo ya que su esposo la abandono cuando su hijo estaba pequeo y por eso busco la manera de vender algo le dejara ingresos y pudiera salir delante.
Lo que ms desea es que con este apoyo que le han brindado logre aumentar ms y mejorar su cocina, para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mara Nieves A. Jimnez lives in Copainala, in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is a single mother of one son, Erik, 17, who is still in her care.
She requests the loan in order to invest it in purchasing ingredients, including meat, vegetables, and tortillas. With this she will make food items that she then will sell in the same town. She has done this for 17 years and says that it's good because through this she has given her only son a good start in life.
She started this work after her husband left when their son was little. Since she was alone, she needed a way of selling something that would give her an income so she could make ends meet.
Her greatest hope is that, with the support offered by FRAC, she can raise more and improve her kitchen, in order to keep working.

loan.use: to purchase ingredients for making food items for sale.

loan.name: Etienne

texts.en: Etienne is 31 years old. He has 4 children who are between one and nine years old. Two of his children are in school, while the other two are not yet school age. Etiennes wife is a farmer. Etienne sells sorghum and makes a drink, called Ubushera, out of it (that's the drink in the photo). He also sells Irish potatoes at wholesale. This business has helped Etienne feed his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and will stock enough to make more of the sorghum drink.

loan.use: to buy sorghum.

loan.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia tiene 65 aos D. edad es casada tiene 3 hijos D. 30, 27 y 25 aos D. edad, cuenta con casa propia D. material noble D. 2 pisos. Julia tiene una tienda bastantate surtida y una maquina mezcladora D. concreto, el cual lo alquila; ella se inicio en este negocio hace 2 aos comenz con la venta D. bebidas posteriormente puso su tienda. con el dinero incrementara y surtira su mercadera D. la tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 65 years old and married. She has three children; ages 30, 27, and 25. She has her own two story house maD. from substantial material.
Julia has a well-stocked store and a concrete mixing machine, which she rents out. She started this business two years ago by selling drinks. Later she set up her store.
She will use the loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store.

loan.use: to stock her store with merchandise

loan.name: Mirene

texts.es:
La seora Mirene C. Hernndez, vive en la localidad ngel Albino corzo conocido tambin como Guadalupe. Ella es casada y tiene a su responsabilidad a dos nietos Alexis de quince aos y Erik Jovani de nueve.
Ella solicito un prstamo en Fundacin Realidad para invertirlo en su pequea tienda de abarrotes pues su mercanca se le termina muy rpido, pero con el prstamo podr tener productos suficientes, con esta actividad lleva nueve aos y comenta que le va bien ya que as ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos nietos.
Para iniciar su actividad lo comento con su esposo para que juntos pudieran trabajar y as lograr ahorrar para poder comprar algunas cosas que le hacan falta en su hogar y darle un bien estar a sus nietos.
Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad as no este basa y sus clientes encuentre lo que desean comprar y con ello mismo tener ms ingresos y apoyar a sus nietos en su educacin.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirene C. Hernndez lives in ngel Albino Corzo, also known as Guadalupe. She is married and has in her care two grandchildren, Alexis, 15, and Erik Jovani, 9.
She requests a loan from FRAC in order to invest in her small grocery store since she goes through her stock very quickly, but with the loan she could have enough products. She has had her store for 9 years and says that it's good because she has been able to give her two grandchildren a good start in life.
She started her store after talking it over with her husband, saying that they could both work and manage to save enough so they could buy some things for their household and make their grandchildren more comfortable.
She will invest the money in her store so she doesn't run out and her customers can find what they want to buy. In this way, she can increase her earnings and support her grandchildren's education.

loan.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loan.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa K. is 33 years old. She's currently in the business of hotel service. She's married to a teacher, and they have six children, all of whom are in school. Her future goal is to build a good house.

loan.use: Stock more Foods.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David M. W. is 36 years old and married to Margaret Wanjiku, who is a house wife. They have one child, who is two years old. David has been supplying charcoal in Mwiki town for 11 years and earns an income of KES.25,300 monthly.
He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to hire a bigger truck so that he can supply charcoal to distant places, e.g, Kitui. The anticipated income will be used to improve the living standards of his family.
In the future, he plans to buy his own truck so that he can be responsible for fuel only and not for a rental.

loan.use: to hire a truck that can transport 150 bags of charcoal

loan.name: Bangu

texts.en: Bangu is currently in a business of selling food items in a hotel. She is 36 years old and married, with two children who go to school. Bangu requested a loan to stock more food items to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business.

loan.use: to stock more food items to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase different kinds of clothing for her business

loan.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine was born in 1967. She has 10 children between the ages of 22 and 2 years. Her oldest three children are in school. She owns a bar in which she sells skewered meat. She started this business before she was married, and now operates it together with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy goats for slaughtering and making skewered meat. With the profits she plans to pay for her childrens medical insurance and also to establish some savings.

loan.use: to buy goats for slaughtering

loan.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Raquel; ella tiene 32 aos de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesana, ella vende en el hotel de yanahuara llamado Casa Andina, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar artesana al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank. The bank is located in the District of Urubamba, part of the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

Raquel is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts. She makes her sales at a hotel in Yanahuara called Casa Andina and works from 5am to 10pm. Raquel uses this business to get her children ahead in life. She is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

Raquel is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loan.use: to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

loan.name: Cielito

texts.es:
La seora Cielito G., vive en la comunidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 estudian la escuela primaria, su esposo es comerciante, vende fruta y verdura en el mercado del pueblo.
Ella y su familia viven en casa de su suegra, y ahora est solicitando un prstamo para su negocio de cra de animales, sta actividad la realiza desde hace varios aos, ella nos comenta: "yo quiero progresar mas y tener mas animales para que tenga mejor rendimiento en el dinero", ella espera tener una buena inversin en los borregos y en los pollos para cuando los venda tenga mas ganancias que antes, ella compra los borregos para que se puedan multiplicar y as pueda brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y los pueda beneficiar. Ella espera ayudar a su esposo para que pronto puedan tener una casa propia. "Quiero hacer ahorros para darle dinero a mi esposo y acabar nuestra casa".
texts.en:
Ms. Cielito Garcia lives in the community of San Francisco Tlachichilpa. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant and sells fruit and vegetables in the town market.
She and her family live in the house of her mother-in-law, and is now asking for a loan for her animal care business. She has been doing this work for a few years and tells us "I want to be able to progress and have more animals in order to make more money." She hopes to make a good investment in lambs and chickens so that when they are sold they will be worth more than before. She buys lambs so that when they reproduce, she will be able to bring her family everything that they need and thus will benefit from the sale. She hopes to help her husband so that they can soon have their own house. She says, "I want to save to be able to give money to my husband and buy our own home."

loan.use: To buy sheep and chickens to raise.

loan.name: Bienfait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick, at left, is the leader of a community bank named Bien Fait Plus, which means "Well Done" in English. It is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
Patrick is 32 years old and single. He runs a cellphone booth. He started his business in 2007 with initial capital of $100. He likes his business because it made more profit due to the high demand in telephone accessories. Patrick decided to diversify his business by purchasing telephone accessories in order to increase his profits. His business brings in US$50 per week. Patrick is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received four loans and has repaid them properly. He is planning with the next loan to purchase phone accessories and re-sell them at a profit. Patrick is working hard because he wants to achieve his ambition of someday opening a general store.

loan.use: to diversify his business by purchasing phone accessories cards and re-selling them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Tososang

texts.en: T. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is 19 years old and single. She has requested a loan to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a rental house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loan.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell

loan.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Mi nombre es Maria Guadalupe, vivo en san francisco tlalchichilpa, mi negocio es vender cokteles de fruta, ya tengo en carrito con el que camino para vender los vasos de coktel, solicite mi prestamo para poder comprar una lona nueva para que me cubra del sol y tambien a los cokteles, tambien quiero comprar un mantel nuevo y comprar la fruta que me hace falta, honestamente vendo bien en mi negocio por el lado de las ventas no me quejo, solo seria el estar caminando empejundo el carro y en la temporada donde hace frio pues las ventas si bajan, pero ahorita me va ir bien ya que estamos en tiempos donde hace mucho sol, y a la gente le gusta se le antoja las cosas frescas, el prestamome va ayudar a tener mas solvencia economica y mejorar mi calidad de vida, y mis deseos son terminar mi casa que empezamos hacer, tengo 2 nios que estudian, tengo 33 aos de edad vivo en union libre desde hace 15 aos, vivo con mi esposo el trabaja como taxista.
texts.en: "My name is Maria Guadalupe, and I live in San Francisco Tlalchichilpa. My business is selling fruit salads. I have a cart that I walk with to sell the cups of fruit salad. I am requesting my loan so that I can buy a new tarp that will protect me from the sun and will also protect the fruit salads. I would also like to buy a new coat and buy the fruit that I need. Honestly, I sell well in my business, and I can't complain about the sales; it is only the walking and pushing the cart in the season when it gets cold, because sales go down. But now it is going to go well for me, since we are in the times when there is a lot of sun, and the people like to snack on something cool. The loan will help me to have better economic solvency and improve my quality of life. My desire is to finish my house, which we have started to build. I have 2 children who are in school. I am 33 years old and I have been living in a common-law marriage for 15 years. I live with my husband who works as a taxi driver."

loan.use: to buy a new canvas tarp and fruit to make her fruit salads.

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 36 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maz, ella tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra maz y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maz. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar maz al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Urubamba, Cusco department.
Francisca is 36 years old, living in a stable relationship, and has 3 children. Daily, she operates a business selling corn. She has farm land where she grows the corn and then sells it in the Urubamba market.
Francisca wants to expand and improve her corn-sales business. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more corn at wholesale. She looks forward to the loan and promises to comply with her scheduled payments.

loan.use: To buy corn at wholesale to resell.

loan.name: Lucia

texts.es: Me llamo Lucia, soy de san Francisco tlachichilpa, tengo una tienda pequea donde vendo abarrotes, dulces, cosas en lata, refresco, aguas, sabritas, tengo un poco de todo, el prestamo lo pienso invertir en mi tiendita, le hacen falta mas cosas para que cuando la gente venga a comprar encuentre lo que esta buscando, y asi poco a poco poder avanzar mas, lo dificil habeces son las ventas, tambien le atribuyo esto a que no hay la suficiente mercancia para vender, por eso quiero el credito para negocio, el credito si va beneficiar a mi familia porque creo que voy a tener mas ventas y mejores ganancias, va haber mas dinero para que mi familia este mejor y tengamos otro tipo de vida, mis deseos es ver a mi negocio mas grande, mas lleno y tambien tener una papeleria ya que por estos rumbos no hay. Soy casada tengo tres hijos que estudian, mi esposo trabaja como albail, la casa es propia y de casada tengo 14 aos, de edad tengo 36 aos.
texts.en:
My name is Lucia, and I am from San Francisco Tlachichilpa. I have a small store where I sell groceries, sweets, canned goods, soft drinks, water, and chips. I have a little bit of everything.
I plan to use the loan to invest in my little store. I need more things so that when people come to shop they find what they are looking for. That way I can get ahead little by little. Sometimes it is difficult making sales. I attribute this to not having sufficient merchandise to sell.
That is why I want the loan for my business. The loan will benefit my family because I believe that I will have more sales and greater earnings. There will be more money so that our family has a better standard of living.
My wish is to see my business expand. I also want to have a stationery store because there is not one around here.
I am married and have three children who attend school. My husband works as a bricklayer. The house is my own. I have been married for 14 years, and I am 36 years old.

loan.use: to buy merchandise like canned chilies, beans, bread, soft drinks and sweets

loan.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Me llamo Soledad y me conocen como Sol todas las personas de aqui de la comunidad de San Francisco tlachichilpa, mi negocio es la cria y engorda de borregos tengo ahorita unos borregos pero son pocos los que tengo ya estan gorditos y ya los voy a vender, por eso quiero comprar ahora mas borregos para tenerlos en cria y se reproduscan y con los que tengo engorda irlos vendiendo para sacar el dinero y no quedar con los pagos en Fundacin, no se me hace dificil cuidar a mis borregos, si es caro el alimento pero yo aprovecho que vivimos entre tanto monte y llano de esa manera saco a comer a mis borregos y regresan bien pansones de tanto comer, el prestamo me va ayudar para tener mas grande mi negocio y lleno de borregos, mis metas son echarle ganas y siempre ver para enfrente para salir adelante, tengo 6 hijos pero ya todos se casaron solo quedo yo y mi esposo viviendo en la casa que es propia, tengo 61 aos de edad y de casada tengo 40 aos.
texts.en:
My name is Soledad. Everyone from here, the San Francisco Tlachichilpa community, knows me as Sol.
My business is raising and fattening sheep. I now have some sheep, but not very many. They are fat, and I am now going to sell them. That is why I want to buy more sheep to raise and have them reproduce. I am going to sell the fat ones that I have, and I will take out the money so that I do not have payments with the Fundacin.
It is not difficult for me to take care of my sheep. Yes, the food is expensive, but I take advantage of the fact that we live between mountains and plains. This way I take my sheep to feed, and they return with big bellies from eating so much.
The loan will help me have a bigger business, which is full of sheep. My goals are to always put forth great effort and to always look forward in order to get ahead.
I have six children, but they are all married. My husband and I are the only ones left in the house, which is our own. I am 61 years old, and I have been married for 40 years.

loan.use: to buy lambs to raise and fatten and to buy fodder for them to eat

loan.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Me llamo Ines, soy de la comunidad de San Francisco Talachichilpa, yo me dedico a bordar, hacer servilletas y de ves en cuando hago chamarritas para los bebes o faldas para las seoras, siempre he tejido y bordado me enseo mi madre y ha sido como ya una costumbre de estar tejiendo, vendo las cosas que hago, por ejemplo vendo mas los manteles para la mesa, cubren toda la mesa y se ven bonitos como adornos, pido el prestamo para hacer manteles y bordados, hacer servilletas y venderlas para ganar dinero, mis deseos es que asi como haga un bordado se venda, es un poco dificil vender lo que hago porque hay mucha gente que sabe bordar y se les hace normal, pero ya saliendo hay mucha gente que les gusta y les atrae el tejido, tengo 11 hijos ya son casados, vivo sola porque enviude, la casa en la que vivo es propia.
texts.en:
My name is Ines, and I am from the San Francisco Tlachichilpa community.
I embroider napkins and sometimes I make jackets for babies or skirts for women. I have always weaved and embroidered. My mother taught me, and it is now like a habit to be weaving. I sell the things that I make.
For example, I sell tablecloths the most. They cover the entire table, and they look pretty as decorations.
I am requesting a loan to make tablecloths and embroideries, to make napkins, and to sell them to earn money.
My wish is that as I make embroidery it sells. It is a little difficult to sell what I make because a lot of people know how to embroider, and they do so regularly. But, it now appears that a lot of people like it and are drawn to woven goods.
I have 11 children who are now married. I live alone because I am a widow. The house in which I live is my own.

loan.use: to buy fabric to embroider and weave

loan.name: Maria Sara

texts.es: Mara, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, es comerciante D. ropa, es casada vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 7 y 9 aos D. edad, el negocio fue iniciativa propia desD. hace 3 aos, trabaja todos los das D. 7:00am a 4:30pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra D. ropa y lociones, esta inversin le ayudara para mejorar con la disponibilidad a los clientes, tener variedad D. mercadera y atraer a nuevos clientes. Su objetivo es mantener el negocio competente para poder financiar todos los gastos D. su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, who lives in the city of San Miguel, sells clothing. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are 7 and 9 years old. She set up the store on her own three years ago. She works every day from 7 am until 4:30 pm.
She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing and lotions. This investment will help her improve the selection available to her customers, have a variety or merchandise, and attract new customers.
Her objective is to manage her business competently so that she can pay for all her family's expenses and continue to advance.

loan.use: to buy clothing and lotions.

loan.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHUARA; El banco est ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juliana; ella tiene 65 aos D. edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. verduras como zanahorias, cebollas, tomates, pepinos y entre otras verduras, y por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. venta D. verduras. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar medicinas para su hijo.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the communal bank SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHUARA. This bank is located in the district of Urubamba which is part of the Urubamba province, belonging to the department of Cusco.
Juliana is 65 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her vegetable business; she sells items such as carrots, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables. With the income from this businss, Juliana raises her children. She would like to improve her vegetable business.
Juliana is seeking a loan to purchase medicines for her son. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments in a timely manner.

loan.use: to purchase medicines for her son

loan.name: Ronald Francisco

texts.es: Ronald tiene 22 aos de edad es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, Ronald tiene una mototaxi el mismo lo trabaja desde hace 1 ao poniendole mucho empeo en su trabajo ya que hace movilidad escolar, Ronal como todo joven tiene sueos y metas y uno de ellos es poder adquirir otra Mototaxi asi poder crecer sus ingresos economicos, con el dinero comprara un toldo y puerta para la mototaxi
texts.en: Ronald is 22 years old and single. He lives in his parents' house, together with his older siblings. Ronald has a moto-taxi, with which he has been working for 1 year. He puts great effort into his work, since he drives schoolchildren starting very early in the morning. Like all young people, Ronald has dreams and goals, and one of these is to acquire another moto-taxi so that he can increase his income. With the money he will buy a canvas cover and door for his moto-taxi.

loan.use: to purchase a canvas cover and a door for his mototaxi

loan.name: Kua Guapa Group

texts.es: El comit Kua guapa se form con la unin de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comit desarrollan actividades diferentes como son las ventas de comestibles, de ropas, zapatos, etc. Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para salir adelante como mujeres luchadoras y madres de familia que son capaces de lograr los objetivos propuestos, de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaerismo. La sra. Venita G. es la presidenta del comit, ella es una microempresaria, comerciante, vende ropas, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace muchos aos y lo sigue realizando pues obtiene buenas ganancias. Puede sacar a su familia adelante y lograr mantener una calidad de vida estable y digna. Ella se da cuenta que posee mucha competencia en su ramo, y ms an porque empieza la oleada de fro y hay mucha demanda de abrigos, por eso solicita el crdito para poder ponerse al da con las mercaderas, comprar en grandes cantidades los abrigos y ropas de invierno, de modo que sus clientes queden satisfechos con ella.
texts.en:
The Kua guapa group is a group of neighbors in the town of Mariano Roque Alonso. Members of the group earn their living in a variety of ways such as sales of clothing, food, shoes, and so on.
The women of this group are humble individuals who joined to form a group so that they could keep moving forward as hard-working women who are mothers to their families and who are capable of achieving the goals they have set for themselves; working together allows the group members to carry out their activities while also strengthening their friendship.
Venita G. is the president of the group -- she is a micro-entrepreneur who works in clothing sales. Vanita has been in this line of work for many years because it generates a good income and allows her to provide for her family and maintain a stable and decent quality of life.
Venita realizes that clothing sales is a very competitive field, especially now that a recent cold wave has created a lot of demand for coats. This why she is seeking a loan that would allow her to bring her inventories up to date, purchasing large quantities of coats and other winter clothing to ensure that her clients continue to be satisfied with the service that she provides.

loan.use: to purchase coats and other winter clothing

loan.name: Gloria

texts.es: Me llamo Gloria, vivo en la localidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, me dedico a engordar reces y tambien al hogar, no tengo problemas con mis actividades ya que en mi casa tengo el tiempo suficiente para hacer la comida la limpieza y para cuidar mis reces, mi esposo trabaja en una carniceria, y ahi mismo vendemos las reces, despues de que la carne se vende yo voy a cobrar como a los 8 dias es cuando me pagan la res que les vendi, ya tengo siempre cliente para mis reces, este prestamo me va ayudar mucho para poder comprar mas reces y su alimento para que engorden, pienso que voy a tener mas ganancias para mi familia y para comprar mas cosas a la casa, mis metas son que tenga mas rendimiento mi dinero y una mejor calidad de vida para toda mi familia, soy casada y tengo 4 hijos que estudian y yo quiero darles una mejor educacin para que les vaya mejor en un futuro, tengo 34 aos y 12 aos de casada, la casa donde vivimos es casa propia pero aun le faltan varias cosas para que se vea bonita.
texts.en: My name is Gloria and I live in the town of San Francisco Tlachichilpa. I devote myself to raising cattle and taking care of my home. I have no problems with my work because I have enough time to do the cleaning and cooking in my house as well as take care of my cattle. My husband works in a butcher shop and this is where we sell the cattle. Eight days later, after the meat is sold, I collect payment for the cattle that I sold them. I always have customers for my cattle. This loan will enable me to buy more cattle and feed to fatten them. I think that I will have more income for my family and be able to buy more household items. My goals are to earn more return on my money and to provide a better quality of life for my entire family. I am married and have 4 children who are students. I want to give them a better education so they will have a better future. I am 34 years old and have been married for 12 years. The house where I live is my own but it still lacks several things to make it look pretty..

loan.use: buy cattle and feed to fatten them.

loan.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Mi nombre es Mercedes, yo tengo una pequea tienda en la localidad de san Francisco tlalchichilpa, vendo refrescos, jugos, papas, y dulces. Las dificultades que tengo en mi negocio es que no tengo para poder estar invirtiendo en mas productos y poder mejorar por eso solicite el prestamo para que me ayude a tener mi negocio mas grande con mas producte y con mejores ganancias para que gane mas dinero, mis metas son que poco a poco pueda ir creciendo y tenga la oportunidad de ampliar el negocio y tambien de poner otro local con cremeria y mejorar mucho, no darme por vencida para que mis sueos se puedan cumplir, tengo una nia que va a la escuela, tengo 44 aos y de casada 27 aos, la cosa donde vivimos es propia y me esposo trabaja en el campo.
texts.en:
My name is Mercedes and I have a small shop in the town of San Francisco Tlalchichilpa. I sell soft drinks, juices, potatoes, and sweets. The difficulty I have in my business is that I have to invest in more products to improve it. This loan request will help me to attain a larger business with more products, which will earn better profits. My goals are to gradually grow and have the opportunity to expand the business and also to install another location with dairy products. I can not give up because I have dreams to fulfill.
I am 44 years old and have been married for 27 years. I have a child who goes to school. We live in our own house and my husband works in the fields.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, bread, and snacks.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: La seora Juana Gnzalez vive en la comunidad de San Francisco, ella se dedica a la venta de ruta y verdura en el mercado de su comunidad y tambin en distintos tianguis, ella dice: " no puedo vender solo en lado porque no se me acaba la mercancia, por eso ando en varios lados y es lo dificil de mi negocio, andar de un lado a otro y los fines de semana", sto es dificil por que ella tiene que subir y bajar la mercancia, adems del trabajo fsico otro riesgo que hay en ese negocio es el que la mercancia puede echarse a perder. Ella ha solicitado un prstamo para tener mas ingresos y una mejor vida, sus sueos vender mucho ms en su negocio y que se vaya haciendo mas grande, con las ganancias que obtenga va a arreglar su casa y la pagar los gastos de la educacon de sus nios que es algo muy importante. Juana tiene 5 hijos, tres dependen de ella y su esposo. Juana tiene 43 aos y 13 aos de casada el negocio que tiene es familiar por lo tanto su esposo tambien se dedica a vender fruta y verdura.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana Gonzalez lives in the community of San Francisco [Mexico]. Her business is selling produce at the market in her community, and also traveling around. She says "I cannot wait and sell only in one spot because I don't run out of merchandise that way. That's why I must move around and that is the most difficult part of my business: traveling all around on weekends." This is difficult because she has to load and unload the merchandise, and in addition to the physical labor also runs the risk of having the fruit spoil.
She has asked for this loan to earn a greater income and thus lead a better life. Her dream is to sell much more produce, and see her business grown. With the earnings, she plans to fix up her house and pay the education expenses of her children, which is very important to her. Juana has 5 children, three of whom depend on her and her husband.
Juana is 43 years old and has been married for 13 years. Her business is a family one, since her husband also works selling fruit and vegetables.

loan.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables, and also a table from which to sell her produce.

loan.name: Ma De Lourdes

texts.es: Mi nombre Lourdes, yo me dedico a hacer recuerdos para eventos, alguna boda, XV aos, bautizos etc. Por lo general me piden que haga servilleteros con los nombres de la personas festejadas, tambien vendo bordados hago un poco de todo para que venda un poco mas, los desafios que enfrento es que espero que mi trabajo les llegue a buscar a la gente porque de eso vivo, por eso procuro hacer las cosas muy bien y que queden bonitas, tambien yo creo que me hace falta mas anuncion para mi trabajo y consiga mas clientes para que me vaya mejor, mis sueos son colar mi casa para que vivamos un poco mejor, soy casada pero mi esposo no vive conmigo y me tengo que hacer cargo de mis tres hijos que estudian, tengo 37 aos y 18 aos de casada.
texts.en: My name is Lourdes and I work making souvenirs for events like weddings, quinceaeras, baptisms, etc. I normally get requests for napkin holders with the names of the people celebrating events. I also sell embroidery work. I do a little bit of everything so that I can sell more. One challenge I face is hoping that my work attracts more customers because this is how I make a living. For this reason I try to make things very well so that they turn out pretty. I would also like to advertise my work more to get more customers and improve my life. I dream of pouring a concrete floor in my home so that we can live a bit better. I am married, but my husband does not live with me. I have to raise my three children who are now studying. I am 37 years old and have been married for 18 years.

loan.use: buy fabric, thread, tablecloths, and make souvenirs for events

loan.name: Reyna

texts.es: Me llamo Reyna, yo me dedico a engordar reces, algunas las compro ya grandecitas y otras las crio desde pequeas, ya tengo mis clientes que seguido vienen por las reces y se las llevan, me pagan mis res como 15 dias despues, por ese lado no tengo mayor problema, lo unico seria que hay que tenerles limpio o tratar de que el lugar este limpio, y me meto al corral a barrerles y sacar todo el escremento, tambien darles de comer sale un poco caro cuando uno quiere tener las reces bien gordas, cada que venda el ganado lo ocupo para mi familia por ejemplo habeces que bajo a cobrar a los clientes pues de paso llevo leche, comida, fruta. Tambien cuando se puede les doy dinero a mis hijos que van a la escuela o los ayuda con ropa, mis metas son superarme y que mi familia vica mejor , finalmente para eso trabaja uno para que a su familia no le haga falta nada y vivamos mejor, con las ganancias son para volverlas a invertir y sacar para la familia de uno, tengo 2 hijos, soy casada desde hace 17 aos, donde vivimos es casa propia y mi esposo es empleado en una fabrica.
texts.en: My name is Reyna and I work raising cows. I buy some already grown and others I raise from the time they are small. I already have customers who regularly come for the cows and take them away. They pay for the cows about two weeks later. I don't have any big problems with my work. The main challenge is keeping the animals and their place clean. I get into the pen to sweep and remove all the manure. It is also a bit expensive to feed them when one wants to have the cows nice and fat. I sell livestock to help my family. For example, sometimes when I go to collect payment I bring milk, food, and fruit and deliver it on the way. I also give my children money when I can when they are going to school or I help them with clothing. My goals are to improve myself and for my family to live better. This is why one works--so that their family doesn't lack anything and so they can live better. I invest my earnings and take what is needed for the family. I have two children. I have been married for 17 years and we live in our own home. My husband works at a factory.
