loan.use: buy cows to fatten

loan.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Soy Emilia, vivo en San Francisco tlachichilpa, mi negocio es una pequea ferreteria no es muy grande pero si vendo lo necesario para hacer una construccin, lo dificil en mi negocio es que no es muy grande el local y quisiera agrandar el local para que hubiera mas mercanca, tambien las ventas son muy pocas y he tenido dias en que no se vende mucho, invirtiendo en mi negocio es como las cosas van ir mejorando, ahora quiero meter carretillas, alambre y clavos en local porque ya se terminaron, mis deseos es agrandar el negocio abriendo otro local ya sea aqui mismo o poner otra ferrteria en otro lugar, ya no tengo dependientes, vivo con un hijo que trabaja, soy viuda y la casa es propia en la que vivo.
texts.en: I am Emilia. I live in San Francisco Tlachichilpa. My business is a small hardware shop. It is not very big but I do sell everything needed for construction. The challenge with my business is that the shop is not very big and I wanted to make it bigger so I could have more merchandise. I also have very few sales and sometimes there are days when not much is sold. Things will improve if I invest in my business. Now I want to stock wheelbarrows, wire, and nails in my store because they ran out. I desire to expand my business and open another store either here or in a different place. I have no dependents and live with a son who works. I am a widow and own the house where I live.

loan.use: buy wheelbarrows, nails, hammers, etc.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es: Mi nombre es Elena G., soy de la comunidad de San Francisco, tengo 31 aos de edad, vivo en union libre desde hace 10 aos, hace poco terminamos de hacer nuestra casa porque anteriormente vivia en casa de mis padres, los cuatro hijos que tengo van a la escuela primaria y son muchos los gastos que hay porque los maestros a cada rato nos piden cosas para que los nios las lleven, el negocio que tengo es la cria de borregos, yo pedi el prestamo para comprar borregos y poderlos criar, no se me hace muy dificil cuidar los animales es muy sencillo para mi porque como tengo un corral ahi los echo y solo les llevo su comida y agua para que tomen, el corral esta techado entonces se protegen los cambios de clima que pueda haber, yo espero que cuando sea tiempo de venderlos me los paquen bien, muchas veces la gente como ve que uno tiene apuros para vender los animales se encajan y los quieren pagar barato y de esa forma ya no tengo las ganancias que deberia de tener. Mis deseos son comprar las cosas que hacen falta en la casa para poder vivir mejor.
texts.en: My name is Elena Garcia, I am from the San Francisco community, and am 31 years old. I have been in a common law relationship for the last 10 years. Recently we finished building our own house since we had previously been living in my parent's home. The four children that I have go to elementary school and there are many expenses because the teachers constantly ask for things that the children need to bring to school. I make a living by raising sheep. I am asking for the loan to be able to buy sheep and be able to raise them. Taking care of the animals is simple for me because I have a corral and I leave them there and only take food and water for them to eat and drink. The corral has a roof and this way they are protected from the weather. I hope that when it comes time to sell them they will fetch a good price. Many times when people see that one is in a hurry to sell the animals, they take advantage and want to buy them cheaper and I don't make the profit that I should make. My wishes are to purchase the things that I still need for my house in order to live better.

loan.use: to purchase sheep for raising and ground corn.

loan.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam, resiD. en Berln, departamento D. Usulutn, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad, tiene casa propia, donD. vive con sus dos hijos D. 14 y 17 aos; El negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Berln, su horario D. atencin es D. 6:00am a 4:00pm. Solicita un prstamo para la compra D. aceite, azcar, frijoles, maz, detergentes y sopas, esta compra le ayudara a tener ms mercadera en el negocio y brindar un servicio ms completo a los clientes. Su aspiracin es estabilizarse en el negocio, contar con mejores ganancias y satisfacer a la clientela, D. esta manera estar ayudando a sus hijos para superarse.
texts.en: Ana Miriam lives in Berln, which is located in Usulutn. She sells basic needs products. She has her own house, where she lives with her two children who are 14 and 17 years old. Her business is located in the municipal market of Berln. Her business hours are from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm. She is asking for the loan to buy oil, sugar, beans, corn, detergents, and soups. This purchase will help her to have more merchandise in the store and to bring a more complete service to her customers. Her aspiration is to establish herself in her business, to make higher earnings, and to satisfy her clientele. In this way she will be helping her children to better themselves.

loan.use: To buy oil, sugar, beans, corn, detergents, and soups.

loan.name: Mukaswa Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Joyce, with hand raised, is a fifty-year-old married woman with seven children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has the sole responsibility of looking after her family and her greatest desire is to construct a permanent house to live in and to educate her family. For eight years, she has been operating a drug shop and her dream is to own a medical centre despite finances challenges of being able to provide the services needed. She is a member of the above- mentioned group and her inspiration to join was the group's mission: "let's develop ourselves." Joyce intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loan.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loan.name: N'venonfon As Group

texts.fr: Le groupement N'VENONFON AS est compos de 12 membres qui habitent tous le mme quartier. La prsidente de ce groupement, du nom de Irne, est celle ayant une main leve sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activit afin de mieux faire face la demande de leur clientle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxime fois l'appui financier de ALID. Irne est ne le 23 Mai 1959 Allada, dans le dpartement de l'Atlantique. Irne est mre de cinq enfants, tous scolariss, dont trois sont sa charge. Irne ne vit plus avec son mari. Il y a prs de trente cinq ans que Irne vit au quartier Enagnon Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin. Irne vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Irne mne comme activit la vente de tissus et d'ustensiles de cuisine (glacires, plats, etc.), ce qui l'aide subvenir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Irne achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin, et les revend par le systme de distribution. Dans le but de renforcer son activit et de satisfaire sa clientle, Irne sollicite ensemble avec ses autres membres, un crdit auprs de ALID. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activit afin d'accrotre son revenu.
texts.en:
The group N'VENONFON AS is composed of twelve members who all live in the same district. The groups president, named Irne, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of raising their level of business, so as to cope better with customer demand, the group members are requesting for the second time financial support from ALID.
Irne was born on May 23, 1959 in Allada, in Atlantique county. She is the mother of five children, who have all had schooling. Three of the children are in her care. She no longer lives with her husband. For nearly thirty years, Irne has lived in the Enagnon district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She lives alone with her children and covers their expenses by herself. She has a business selling cloth and kitchen utensils (insulated containers, platters, etc.). This helps her to support herself and her children. She buys these products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and resells them by the distribution system.
With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying her customers, Irne, along with the other group members, is requesting a loan from ALID. Her ambition is to strengthen her business further in order to grow her revenues.

loan.use: to buy cloth, platters, and insulated containers.

loan.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Mi nombre es Margarita, solicite mi prestamo para invertirlo en un puesto de legumbres, vendo en un tianguis en el mercado y abro diario, nesecito mas mercanca porque ya no tengo mucha y tampoco el dinero suficiente para ir a surtir y se va lleno el puesto, los desafios que tengo son varios para empezar el horario hay que ir abrir muy tenmprano como desde las 5 de la maana diario hay que salir de mi casa para llegar al puesto como a las 6 de la maana y empezar a acomdar las cosas y estar listo antes de las 8 de la mana que es cuando la gente sale a comprar, la otra situacin es cuando no se vende alguna cosa, la verdad es que cuando no se vende la verdura se empieza a echar a perder y se pierde la inversin y tambien la ganancia, se corren varios riesgos y es un trabajo de todo el dia y se hace pesado. Mis deseos son que con el prestamo pueda salir adelante e incrementar las ventas que es el objetivo, tambien en un futuro queremos hacer nuestra casa porque no tenemos vivimos en casa de mis suegros, mi esposo trabaja como chofer, tenemos dos hijas pequeas, yo tengo 22 aos y vivo en union libre desde hace 4 aos.
texts.en:
My name is Margarita and my loan request is to invest in a vegetables stall. I sell vegetables at a small outdoor market that is open daily. I need more merchandise because I don't have much, and I don't have enough money to stock the stall full.
I have many challenges: to start, my schedule starts very early, every day from 5 AM I have to leave my house to get to the stall by 6 AM to start and prepare things. I have to be ready before 8 AM, which is when people start shopping. The other situation in selling is that when you don't sell, the produce begins to spoil and you lose your investment. You run several risks and it is heavy work that lasts all day. My wish is that with the requested loan I can get ahead with the goal of increasing sales.
Also, in the future, (my common-law partner and I), would like to build our own house so that we don't have to live at home with my in-laws. My common-law partner works as a driver and we have two young daughters. I am 22 years old and have lived in a common-law marriage for 4 years.

loan.use: to buy vegetables for later sale, such as lettuce, radishes, etc.

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Mi nombre es Marcelina, yo vivo en San Francisco tlachichilpa, tengo 46 aos de edad enviude hace un par de aos, la casa donde vivo con mis tres hijos me la dejo mi marido, si la veo mi situacin un poco dificil porque mis hijos quieren seguir estudiando para que tengan mejores oportunidades de tener un trabajo y yo los quiero ayudar a cumplir sus metas, por eso me dedico a vender zapatos, los vendo por catalogo y tambien los vendo de segunda mano en el tianguis que se pone cada domingo een el pueblo, de esta forma es como ayudo a mis hijos con lo que se puede porque no siempre puedo apoyarlos como uno quisiera, los dasfios que voy teniendo es que habeces tengo que fiar la mercanca, no siempre los clientes tienen para pagar todo de contado y los tengo que esperar a que cobren quincena para que me den el resto, yo quisiera que el negocio funcionara de una mejor manera y tubiera mucha suerte para salir adelante.
texts.en: My name is Marcelina and I live in San Francisco, Tlachichilpa. I am 46 years old and was widowed a couple of years ago. The house where I live with my three children was left to me by my husband. I see my situation as being a little difficult because my children want to continue studying so that they can have a better opportunity of getting work and I want to help them to achieve their goals. For this reason, I work selling shoes. I sell the shoes through a catalog and I also sell second-hand shoes in the street market which takes place in our village every Sunday. This is how I help my children as best I can. I can't always support them as I would really like. One of the difficulties I face is that I have to sell my merchandise on credit. My customers don't always have enough money to pay cash and so I have to wait two weeks for them to get their wages before they pay me the rest of the money they owe me. I would like my business to work better and I would like to be lucky enough to get ahead in life.

loan.use: to buy shoes to sell

loan.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario est casado con la Sra. Matilde hace varios aos, tienen 6 hijos de los cuales 3 son menores y 3 ya estn casados e independientes de ellos. Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que est ubicado en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeo capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados. Gracias al trabajo que estn realizando han educado a sus hijos y comprado todas las necesidades de su hogar. El Sr. Mario adems de la despensa trabaja como mecnico en su casa, mont un pequeo taller para que de esa manera pueda aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su esposa con los gastos del hogar. Es la primera vez que solicita el crdito de Kiva, espera contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas, ya que en su expediente crediticio ha tenido muy buenas referencias, desea el prstamo para la compra de mercaderas varias, azcar, arroz, fideo, jabones, artculos de limpieza, artculos de aseo personal y otros.
texts.en:
Mario has been married to Matilde for several years. They have six children. Three of their children are still dependent while the other three are already married and live independently.
Together, Mario and his wife set up a grocery store in their home which is located in a very densely-populated neighborhood. They started out with a little capital from the wages that they made in their previous jobs.
Thanks to their work, they have educated their children and been able to buy everything they need for their household. In addition to running their grocery store, Mario also works from home as a mechanic. He set up a small workshop so that he could increase his income and help his wife to cover their household expenses.
This is the first time that Mario has requested a Kiva loan. He hopes to receive help from Kiva lenders since he has very good references in his credit file. He would like the loan to buy a variety of merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, soap, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loan.use: to buy a variety of merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, soap, cleaning products, personal care products, etc.

loan.name: Griselda Lucia

texts.es:
Griselda de 32 aos, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de confeccin y costura. Ella aprendi a temprana edad confeccionar y coser ropa poco a poco con un capital invirti en telas y convirti la confeccin en su actividad econmica.
En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00 de lunes a sbados, cose y confecciona uniformes y ropa de distintas personas que le hacen por pedido. Los uniformes deportivos los vende a $ 5.60, los vestidos a $ 18.00, costuras para mujeres a $ 15.00. Quiere continuar con su negocio pero para ello necesita tener materia prima como tela, hilos, botones para confeccionar mas ropa. En el futuro quiere tener un taller bien surtido.
texts.en:
Griselda is a hardworking 32-year-old woman who has a sewing workshop. She learned to make and sew clothing at an early age and little by little, she invested in fabrics and created her business.

She currently works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 6pm. She sews and makes uniforms and clothing for different people who place orders with her. She sells sports uniforms at $5.60, dresses at $18.00, and womans clothing at $15.00. Griselda wants to continue with her business, but she needs raw materials such as fabric, thread and button to make more clothing. In the future, she wants to have a well-stocked workshop.

loan.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loan.name: Paix Plus Group

texts.en: Evelyne is the leader of the community bank named Paix Plus, which means "peace" in English. The group is made up of 10 members firmly united to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI (microfinance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses. Evelynes main business is selling loaves of bread in her area west of Kinshasa. Since 2004, she has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to achieve her dream of one day opening a large bread facility. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $50 per week. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. Evelyne is a trustworthy client of HOPE RDC, having seven times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying 40 trays of loaves of bread and reselling them at a profit. Evelyne is 40 years old, married and has five children whose ages vary between 4 and 11 years old. Four of the children go to school.

loan.use: to reinforce her working capital and purchase 40 trays of loaves of bread to resell them at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy accessories and maintenance for his vehicle.

loan.name: Manchaster Group

texts.en:
Sharifa S. is in her early 30s and is married with one young child. She has been running a vegetable business for two years and works from 5:00 a.m. to midday (seven hours). She is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be Sharifa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more vegetables and successfully paid it back. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of vegetables. Her dream is to one day be able to take her kid to a good school and also build her own house.
Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Manchaster, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.
In the picture, Sharifa is first on the left.

loan.use: to increase stock of vegetables

loan.name: Jose Asencion

texts.es: Jos, es empleado y administra una venta de comida tpica, reside en San Miguel, l vive con su familia, tiene un hijo de 9 aos de edad; La venta de comida la realiza en su vivienda y quien se encarga de preparar los alimentos en su esposa. l quiere ofrecer ms productos de alimentacin y solicita un prstamo que le permita comprar lo suficiente en aceite, frijol, arroz, carnes, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar las ganancias. Jos quiere tener un negocio rentable y poseer una vivienda propia para estar con su familia.
texts.en:
Jos is an employee and runs a business selling traditional food. He lives in San Miguel with his family. He has a 9 year-old son.
Jos sells the food from his home. It is prepared by his wife. Jos would like to offer more food products and he is requesting a loan to buy enough oil, beans, rice and meat. This purchase will help him to increase his profits. Jos would like to have a profitable business and own his own home to live in with his family.

loan.use: to buy oil, beans, rice and meat

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy combs, straighteners, dyes, powders, shampoo treatments, creams, and other necessary items.

loan.name: Mara Dolores

texts.es:
La seora Mara dolores P. L., es madre soltera con un hijo a su responsabilidad de nombre Deiser de veinti tres aos de edad que tambin la apoya con los ingresos de la casa.
Ella solicito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercanca para surtir su mini tienda de abarrotes, en la que lleva diez a aos y ocho meses, que con eso que saco adelante a su familia, dando les una buena educacin para que puedan sostenerse.
Ella comenz con esta actividad por su propia voluntad ya que quera darles lo mejor a sus hijos que venan creciendo y gracias adis le fue bien porque sigue con su pequeo trabajo que comenz de poco en poco y ahora lo ve mejor.
Lo que ms desea es tener un lugar ms amplio para poder surtir mejor su negocio con cosas que su clientela requiere comprar.
texts.en:
Mara Dolores P. L. is a single mother responsible for her 23-year-old son named Deiser. He also helps with the household income.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her mini-grocery store. She has had this business for 10 years and 8 months and uses it as a means to get her family ahead in life, providing them with a good education so that they can support themselves.

She started this business herself because she wanted to give the best to her children who were growing up. Thanks to God, she did well because she continues with her small business that she started little by little.

What she wants most is to have a larger space to be able to better stock her business with items that her customers need to buy.

loan.use: to buy merchandise like oil, beans, flour, sugar, etc. to stock her grocery store.

loan.name: Sao

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Soa S.. She is married and has three children. She has two additional dependents who are sons of her elder brother.
For the past 11 years, Soa has been selling slippers, plastic bowls, cotton, ladies dresses, mobile phones, etc., in Freetown city. She began this business because she was inspired by the successes of her aunty in the same type of business and believed that the business could be a means of helping her husband provide a livelihood for their family.
She opens her business six days a week and 12 hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 Sierra Leone leones. Sao requires a loan in order to buy a bale of wax cotton at Le 2,300,000; assorted plastic bowls at Le 1,500,000; and ladies dresses at Le 1,000,000. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to buy bales of wax cotton, plastic bowls and ladies dresses

loan.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina G. P., vive en tecpatan estado de Chiapas Mxico, ella es viuda con tres hijos a su responsabilidad y son: Julio Cesar de dieciocho aos de edad, Marco Antonio de dieciseis aos y el ms pequeo es Jos Leopoldo de trece aos. Ella solcito el prstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliado (destazado), en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva ocho mese de lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello est logrando incrementar sus ingresos de su hogar. Comenz con esta actividad para solventar sus gastos que se generan en su hogar, comenzando con la educacin de dos de sus hijos que estudian en preparatoria y se generan gastos en sus actividades y ella quiere que tengan lo mas necesario para lograr sus objetivo. Lo que ms desea es que con el tiempo pueda tener su actividad ms grande para seguir trabajando y continuar apoyando a sus hijos a que le echen ganas y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Carolina G. P. lives in Tecpatan in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is a widow and has three children under her care: Julio Cesar (18), Marco Antonio (16) and Jos Leopoldo (13).

She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of chickens that she will butcher and dress to sell in her area. She has been in this business for eight months and tells us that it is going well, as she is increasing her household income.

She started this business to cover her familys expenses, beginning with the education of her two children in high school who need money for their activities. She wants them to have the necessities to achieve their goals.

What she wants most is for her business to be larger to continue working and supporting her children so that they are motivated and finish their education.

loan.use: to buy chickens.

loan.name: Maritza Maribel

texts.es: Maritza, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulutn, se dedica a la venta de tortas y hamburguesas, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo y dos hijos uno de 5 aos y el otro de 1 ao de edad. El negocio es un chalet que inicio por sus propios medios desde hace 3 aos, la tiene ubicada en el parque de Jucuapa y su horario de venta es de 9:00am a 7:00pm. Ella solicita un prstamo para comprar pan, embutidos, gaseosas, aceite, papel especial y papel aluminio, condimentos y todo lo necesario para preparar los productos. La compra ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de mercadera, teniendo ms capacidad para atender a los clientes. Sus aspiraciones es ampliar el chalet, atender bien a los clientes y aumentar su nmero, tener mejores ganancias y una calidad de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Maritza livs in Jucuapa, a region of Usulutn. She works selling sandwiches and hamburgers. She has her own home where she lives with her husband and their two children, who are 5 and 1 year old. She started her business independently three years ago, and it is located in the park in Jucuapa. She sells food from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm.

She is asking for a loan to buy bread, meat, sodas, oil, aluminum foil, condiments, and other items necessary to prepare her foods. Buying these items will allow her to serve more customers. She hopes to expand her business, have good customer service, attract more customers, increase her income, and have a different quality of life.

loan.use: buy bread, lunch meat, sodas, oil, aluminum foil, and condiments

loan.name: Ola Marina

texts.es:
La seora ola Marina C. J. es casada con el seor Jorge Mrquez Gutirrez, y con quien procreo tres hijos de los cuales una ya es independiente y dos siguen a su responsabilidad: Elver de quince aos, Estefani Joanna de trece quienes estudian en la secundaria.
El prstamo solicitado lo invirti en la compra de zapatos por catalogo de la marca "Andrea, Terra e Impulso", en donde lleva seis meses y comenta que le est funcionando bien este negocio, as apoya su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.
En ello comenz por su propia creatividad, para poder tener su propio dinero en lo que se pueda estar apoyando con para darle lo ms necesario a sus hijos que dependen de ella.
lo que ms desea es tener un negocio propio de lo que ms adelante pueda depender y as seguir apoyando a sus muchachos que estn estudiando y puedan superarse ms adelante.
texts.en:
Ola Marina C. J. is married to Jorge Mrquez Gutirrez, with whom she has three children. One of their children is already independent, but two are still their dependents - Elver (15) and Estefani Joanna (13), who are high school students.

She has requested the loan to invest in the purchase of shoes by the brand Andrea, Terra e Impulso from a catalog. She has been in this business for six months and she says that it is working out well and she uses it to support her husband with the household income.

She started the business with her own creativity in order to have her own money to use to provide her dependent children with the necessities.

What she wants most is to have her own business which she can later depend on and use to continue supporting her children who are studying and so that they can succeed in the future.

loan.use: to buy shoes from a catalog to then sell.

loan.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken A. is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his family in the village of Vachiani, Akhalkalaki district a mountainous part of Georgia. Babken and his wife, Narine, have three children: 17- and 18-year-old daughters and a 9-year-old son. All of them go to school. Babkens retired mother also lives with them.
The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. Babken and his wife are actively involved in the family business. In particular, the family has three milk cows and eight calves. Dairy products are sold in a nearby village and the calves are sold locally. Also, the family owns 3.8 ha of agricultural land. Almost half of this land is used for growing potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to vegetable wholesalers.
One part of the requested loan will be used for purchasing additional calves which will be raised and sold at a higher price. The other part will be spent on purchasing materials for cultivating the land where potatoes will be sown.
Babken and Narine hope that they will have a productive year and a good harvest. They plan to reinvest their profit to further develop the familys agricultural activities.

loan.use: to purchase calves and material for cultivation of the land.

loan.name: Abou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abou L. est un jeune qui habite dans la localit de Dalifort. Il exerce lactivit de tailleur depuis plusieurs annes. Il fait des prestations de service dans le domaine de la couture, en mme temps il achte des tissus quil confectionne et revend a la population de Dalifort. Il a choisi cette activit par ncessit dans le but de gagner sa vie afin daider ses parente et de se prendre en charge lui mme. Monsieur L. est socitaire au guichet de Dalifort de puis juin 2007. Il a dj rembours 4 prts antrieurs. Il sollicite un crdit de 400 000 frs prvu pour lachat de tissus et de fournitures destins a confectionner des habits quil va exposer a la vente. Ce financement lui permettra daccroitre ses bnfices et damliorer sa situation sociale ainsi que celle de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Abou L. is a young man who lives in the town of Dalifort. He has been working as a tailor for several years. As well as providing tailoring services he also buys fabric which he makes up into clothes and resells to people in Dalifort. He was obliged to choose this business in order to be able to make a living, help his famiL. and look after himself.
Mr. L. has been a shareholder-member of the Dalifort branch since June 2007. He has already repaid four previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs with which he intends to buy fabric and materials to help him make clothes which he will display with a view to selling. This loan will allow him to increase his profits and improve his and his famiL.'s social situation.

loan.use: to buy fabric and sewing materials

loan.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is a 35-year-old married woman with four children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She takes care of her family with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. Their dream is to construct rental houses. She operates a retail shop and has been in business for seven years with minimal hardships. Her initial capital was 1,000,000, but her business has steadily grown so that she now boasts of 3,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her desire is to own a wholesale shop. Robinah needs this loan to buy salt, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loan.use: to buy salt, rice and groundnuts to sell.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. lives in the Kisaasi neighbourhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, none of whom are in school. Betty sells secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven day a week. Betty sells her products wholesale/retail at the market. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.
Betty also generates additional income through a bar. The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal for her business is to start importing secondhand clothes.
Betty lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loan.name: Aida Esther

texts.es: Aida P. desD. la ciudadela 20 D. Julio enva muchos agradecimientos a sus financiadores en Kiva y piD. que la sigan apoyando porque gracias a Kiva ha aumentado sus ingresos, en la actualidad est solicitando su segundo credikiva y con el surtir su negocio con dulces, bebidas y refrescos, los que planea comprar al por mayor para volver a ganar ms descuentos y aumentar u poco ms su capital D. trabajo. Si usted quiere conocer la historia D. Aida P. ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://www.kiva.org/lend/193449
texts.en:
Aida P. sends many thanks from the 20 D. Julio neighborhood to the Kiva lenders. She asks that they continue helping her. Thanks to Kiva, her income has increased.
She is currently requesting her second Kiva loan. She will use it to stock her business with sweets, drinks, and soft drinks. She plans on making her purchases wholesale in order to gain more discounts and increase her working capital a little.
If you want to learn Aida P.s story, go to the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/193449

loan.use: to buy sweets, drinks and soft drinks wholesale and for cash

loan.name: Nonvigbe Tankp Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGBE Tankp est compos D. 20 membres qui sont solidaires et qui vivent tous dans le mme quartier Tankp dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. C'est la deuxime fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aiD. financier D. ALID, afin d'lever le niveau D. leur activit. La reprsentante du groupe, du nom D. Ida est celle qui a le doigt lev sur la photo. Ida est ne le 14 Avril 1973 Abomey, ville historique du Bnin. Ida est marie Alexandre et a six enfants, tous scolariss, dont trois sont sa charge. Ida et son mari assurent ensemble les diffrentes charges D. la famille. Depuis prs D. onze ans, Ida s'est installe Tankp avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin D. se prendre en charge et d'amliorer son niveau D. vie, Ida exerce depuis six ans environs, comme activit la vente d'pices et D. csame, qu'elle achte Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. Dans la qute D. la satisfaction D. sa clientle et pour accrotre son revenu, Ida sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crdit.
texts.en:
The group NONVIGBE Tankp is composed of twenty members in solidarity who all live in the same district in Tankp, in the commune of Abomey Calavi. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALID, so as to elevate their level of business.
The groups representative, by the name of Ida, is the one with her finger raised in the photo. Ida was born on April 14, 1973 in Abomey, a historic city in Benin. She is married to Alexandre and has six children, who are all in school. Together, Ida and her husband ensure that the various family expenses are covered.
Almost eleven years ago, Ida settled in Tankp with her husband and children. In order to support herself and to improve her living conditions, she has had a business selling spices and sesame for about six years. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to grow her revenues, Ida, along with her group, is requesting another loan.

loan.use: to buy spices

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: buy fertilizer and improved seed corn

loan.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La seora Sandra Maria se dedica a una pulpera ubicada en su casa de habitacin. Pues siempre est buscando la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Realiza sus compras de contado en mercados y a camiones repartidores, ella compra la mayora de sus productos en el mercado ya que los precios son ms baratos y le generan ms ingresos, sus ventas las efecta de contado y al crdito. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, botellas de agua y jugos el cual est generando ingresos favorables, la seora vive de manera moderada y cuenta con todos los servicios bsicos.
texts.en: Sandra Maria has a small store located in her home, as she is always looking for a way to earn money for her family. She makes her cash purchases in markets and from delivery trucks. She buys the majority of her products at the market, as the prices are lower and she can earn more money. She makes her sales on credit and accepts cash. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business and purchase sweets, soft drinks, bottles of water and juices, with which she is making good money. Sandra Maria lives modestly and has all the basic utilities.

loan.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, bottles of water and juice.

loan.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. has been selling palm oil at Mfuom near Abura for thirty years. Esi has a high-school education and is a widow with four children. Esi wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan to purchase additional quantities of palm fruit for sale. The profit realized from her sales will be used to buy an oil-extracting machine. In the photograph, Esi is standing next to her machine extracting the oil she will sell.

loan.use: to purchase additional quantities of palm fruit for sale.

loan.name: Intihuatana Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal INTIHUATANA; Este banco est ubicado en el Poblado D. Huaraypata, del Distrito D. Quiquijana, provincia D. Quispicanchis y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Pascuala: es casada y tiene 38 aos D. edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos D. 18 y 14 aos D. edad; la socia tiene como actividad principal la venta D. comida y chicha, la socia tiene una tienda en el poblado D. Huaraypata en una esquina en el que se renen todos los socios del banco comunal, en esta tienda la socia tiene una pequea vitrina en el cual exhibe golosinas, galletas y todo tipo D. dulces, bebidas gaseosas y cervezas y esta tienda a su vez es una chichera, en la puerta antes D. ingresar a esta tienda la socia tiene una meza en la cual lleva ollas y venD. comida casera, generalmente la socia elabora comida casera y en tapar los lleva al colegio para ser vendida a los maestros del plantel D. estudios, el esposo D. la socia es cocinero y trabaja directamente en la regin y ambos cuando estn juntos se dan la mano para que prospere sus negocios y puedan educar a sus hijos. La socia solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para mejorar sus negocios.
Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta D. flores porque este poblado por el bello clima que tiene da flores D. todo color y ellos pueden realizar un mercado a base D. esto, tambin los socios se dedican a al crianza D. animales menores como cuyes, pollos, chanchos, patos, el socio Hctor es maestro, y otras dos socias tiene sus tiendas D. abarrotes.
La socia est muy agradecida por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho prstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a member of the communal lender INTIHUATANA, located in Huaraypata, Quiquijana District, Quispicanchis Province, Cusco. Pascuala is 38 and married, with two children, ages 18 and 14. She maintains a store and sells food and chicha in Huaraypata on a corner where many members of the community gather. The store also offers sweets, candy, cookies, beer, soft drinks and home-cooked food. She also sells food at a local school to serve the teaching staff; her husband is a cook and together they run the business to benefit their family. Pascuala seeks credit to increase her inventory and thus expand her sales.
Other members of the communal lending association sell flowers, which grow well in due to the pleasant climate of the region. Some raise domestic animals for market, and one member, Hctor, is a teacher, while two other members run small general stores.
Pascuala is grateful for the loan and is committed to prompt repayment according to lender terms.

loan.use: To buy inventory for her business

loan.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es: Doa Candelaria, se dedica a la venta D. ropa, tiene 44 aos D. edad y 10 aos D. tener el negocio, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal D. El Transito, tiene casa propia donD. vive con su esposo y un hijo. Ella solicita un prstamo para la compra D. mercadera, ya que quiere surtir el negocio en blusas, faldas, short, y todo lo relacionado al verano. Con esta compra espera tener mayor afluencia D. clientes y poder satisfacer sus gustos. Su aspiracin es tener mejores ventas y aumentar la clientela, ir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria works selling clothing. She is 44 years old and has had this business for 10 years. It is located in the city market of El Transito. She has her own home where she lives with her husband and son.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise, since she wants to stock blouses, skirts, shorts, and other summer items. By buying these products she hopes to attract more customers and proviD. what they desire. Her dream is to increase sales and attract more customers to keep growing as a small-business owner.

loan.use: buy blouses, skirts, shorts, and other summer items

loan.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es: El comit Luchadoras tiene ms de 2 ciclos de trabajo con la Fundacin Paraguaya, la mayora de sus integrantes ya realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 6 seoras que emprendern recin sus actividades. La sra. Nelly se dedica a la venta de ropas, es un rubro en el cual est desde hace una dcada aproximadamente, pues ha descubierto que si se ofrece muy buena calidad de productos, los clientes se vuelven usuarios fieles de estos, por eso se ha mantenido con buena reputacin dentro de este mbito. Ella desea poder ampliar su stock de productos, por eso es que solicita el crdito, para poder comprar ropas como pantalones, remeras, camisillas, polleras, tohallas, etc. Las mujeres de este comit son todas muy trabajadoras, que poseen la esperanza de poder ir aumentando su calidad de vida, de poder adquirir un mejor futuro para sus familias, ellas confan plenamente en que podrn recibir la ayuda de Kiva.
texts.en:
The Luchadoras (Fighters) Group has completed more than two loan cycles with the Fundacin Paraguaya. The majority of its members already have profitable businesses, but six of the women recently began their businesses.

Mrs. Nelly works selling clothing. It is an area where she has worked for about 10 years. She has discovered that if she offers very good quality products, her customers return and they become faithful clients. In this way she has earned a very good reputation. She desires to stock more products and is asking for a loan to buy clothing, such as pants, T-shirts, tank-tops, skirts, towels, etc.

The women in this group are all very hard-working and share the hope of continuing to improve their quality of life and achieve a better future for their families. The fully trust that they will receive help from Kiva.

loan.use: buy T-shirts, shorts, tank-tops, pants, skirts, towels, etc.

loan.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah K. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Norah has had a bar business for less than a year, and she works 7 days every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Norah has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and soda, and boxes of mineral water. She generates additional income through renting rooms.
The main business challenges for Norah are seasonality and payment defaulters. Her goal for her business is to build her own shop. Norah lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent for the shop .

loan.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda, and boxes of soap

loan.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells yams and cooked food at Mfuom near Abura. Maame has been through junior high school. She is married and they live together with her four children.
Her business is a year old. She is supportive by contributing to the daily feeding of her family. A loan will enable her to buy a large quantity of yams for resale. She hopes to plow her new profit back into her business.

loan.use: to buy a large quantity of yams for resale

loan.name: El Limonal Group

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la contumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.
Don Vicente R. es uno de los habitantes de esta comunidad, Don Vicente(viste un pantalon negro y una playera azul) nos platica que desde hace aos su padre le enseo a trabajar en el campo en la siembre de limones, el nos platica que la siembra de limon es una actividad que se realiza en familia ya que todos trabajan en la cosecha, tambien nos platica que al morrir su padre le hered las parcelas y ahora es el quien esta acargo de la simbra y el cultivo, don Vicente no solo se dica al limon sino que tambien tiene una pequea tiendita de abarrotes a la cual a llamado "Abarrotes Los tres R." en honor a su padre. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para resurtir su tienda y tambien en la compra de algunos fertilizantes para su cultivo. Don Vicente espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea continuar invirtiendo en el para que cada dia cresca mas. El envia un saludo y mucho agradecimiento a todas las personas que hacen posible estos microcreditos. Las otras 5 personas que integran este grupo son: Guillermina L. V. - polleria Hilda R. A. - antojotos mexicanos Erick leonardo M. A. -Fletes y mudanza Minerva A. M. - Pollo Francisco P. Velazques - Productos agricolas
texts.en:
In La Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a community called Paso Rincon, known for its lemons. It is the custom here that the whole family work with the harvest, from the children to the parents and grandparents.

Mr. Vicente R. is one of the members of this community. Vicente (wearing black pants and a blue T-shirt) shared with us that many years ago, his father taught him to work in the field with the lemon harvest. He told us that planting the lemon trees is a family activity and that everyone also helps with the harvest. When his father died, he inherited the plots of land and is now in charge of the planting and harvesting. Mr. Vicente does not only work with the lemons but also has a small grocery store named "Three R. (Kings) Grocery Store" in honor of his father. He needs this loan to buy rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juice, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned chili peppers to restock his store and also to buy some fertilizer for his crops.

He hope that this investment will help his business prosper and return high earnings since he desires to keep investing in the store so that it grows more each day. He sends a greeting and many thanks to everyone who help make these loans possible.

The other five people in the group are:

Guillermina L. V. - chickens Hilda R. A. - Mexican snacks Erick Leonardo M. A. - transportation and moving Minerva A. M. - chickens Francisco P. Velazques - agricultural products

loan.use: plant lemon trees, and buy groceries and chickens

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loan.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is divorced. Afia sells plantains and African-made local beads at Mfuom near Abura. She sells the beads by moving from one area to the other. Her business is about four years old.
Afia will use the loan to purchase extra beads to expand her sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afia plans to save to build a jewelery shop.

loan.use: to purchase extra beads to expand her sales.

loan.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen T. is 26 years old. He comes from the village of Khulgumo, Akhalkalaki District. Armen is married. He recently became a father and his son is now 5 months old. Armen and his brothers family live in the same house. Armens brother is married as well and has two children.
The source of income for the family is agriculture, in particular potato growing. They own agricultural land with an area of 1 ha, where potatoes are grown. The harvested potatoes are sold locally to the wholesalers.
Armen requested from Credo an agricultural loan in the amount of 1000 Gel. The credit will be used for purchasing fertilizers, which will be used for fertilizing his land. This will increase the productivity of the land and Armen will have a good harvest. The earned profit will be used for improving the familys living conditions.

loan.use: to pay for fertilizers.

loan.name: Rober

texts.es: Rober tiene 40 aos, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo y a la ganadera, tiene sus propios terrenos de cultivos que ha heredado de sus padres, es as que tiene la oportunidad de se sembrar papa, maz, habas, arveja, trigo y zanahoria, que junto a su esposa verifican cada mes el crecimiento favorable de sus plantas. Por otro lado vende animales, eso lo ayuda en la economa, ya que hubo momentos de perdida debido al cambio climtico echando a perder sus cosechas. Pero nunca se ha rendido y siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante, una de ellas es de trabajar de manera dependiente mientras su esposa cuida los campos; y cuando llega la temporada de la siega se rene con su familia para cosechar y vender todo lo producido en el mercado local y todas el capital que rene es nuevamente invertido en la agricultura. Es su crdito nmero 5 que tiene con MFP, en esta oportunidad ha solicitado un crdito individual pero tiene un buen concepto de los crdito grupales adems de que esta agradecido por las oportunidades que ha recibido y se compromete una vez mas a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero estar destinado a la compra de sacos de abono para su prxima siembra.
texts.en:
Rober is 40 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in their own home. All his life he has worked on the farm and with livestock. He has his own crops of land he inherited from his parents so that he has to opportunity to grow potatoes, corn, beans, peas, corn and carrots. His wife checks every month on the favorable growth of their plants.
Rober also sells animals to help their finances, as there were moments of loss due to climate change ruining their crops. But he has never surrendered and has always sought ways to get ahead, one of which is working as a private employee while his wife takes care of the fields. When it is harvest season, he reunites with his family to harvest and sell everything produced in the local market. All the profits are then invested in agriculture again.
This is Rober's 5th loan with MFP. This time he has requested an individual loan, but he has a good concept of group loans. He is grateful for the opportunities he has received and is committed once again to be punctual in his payments. The money will be used to buy bags of fertilizer for next season.

loan.use: to buy bags of fertilizer.

loan.name: Jesus Boanerges

texts.es: Jess siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador que disfruta de actividad econmica. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado y leche, es una persona muy conocida por esta actividad. Tiene ms de 2 aos en esta actividad, su experiencia le ha dado una gran ayuda para mantener a sus clientes, pues ha sido muy satisfactorio. Por lo que tena que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia. Este crdito es para la compra de ganado y una gran cantidad de leche. Desea proporcionar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Jess has always been a hardworking man that enjoys economic activity. His business is buying and selling livestock and milk, and he is well-known for this activity. He has been in this business for more than 2 years. His experience has been a great help to keep his customers, thus it has been very satisfactory. Jess had to find a means of income for his family. This loan is for the purchase of cattle and a large quantity of milk. He would also like to provide home improvements.

loan.use: to purchase cattle and a large quantity of milk.

loan.name: Viviana Cenith

texts.es: Viviana P. de 29 aos vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cnyuge y su hijo de 4 aos de edad, all tiene un negocio llamado Tienda donde Ral que inici cuando hace muchos aos percibi la oportunidad de manejar una tienda y su esposo prest el dinero para arrendarla, e iniciar la venta de vveres por primera vez pues en el pasado se haba dedicado solo a vender productos cosmticos mediante guas especializadas, Con su gestin en los negocios Viviana ha logrado apoyar los ingresos de su hogar que antes solo estaban a cargo de su cnyuge. Su sueo es comprar su propia casa para definirle un futuro estable a su hijo, con el que suea verlo convertido en un profesional de xito; entre sus metas personales est en ver su negocio convertido en un multimercado bien surtido, por eso se esfuerza diariamente y est aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprar de contado, ganar descuentos por la compra en efectivo y en volmenes de vveres y tambin de un enfriador de mayor capacidad que el que actualmente tiene.
texts.en:
Viviana P., 29, lives in the town of Soledad, with her husband and 4 year-old son. She started her business, called "Tienda donde Ral" many years ago when she saw the opportunity to run a store. Her husband lent her the money to rent it and to start selling groceries for the first time, since before that she had only sold cosmetics through specialized catalogs.
Through her management of the business, Viviana has been able to contribute to the household income that before came solely from her husband. Her dream is to buy her own house in order to establish a stable future for her son, who she dreams will become a successful professional.
Among her personal goals is to see her business become a well-stocked supermarket. She strives for this daily and is applying for her first loan with Fundacin Mario Santo Domingo to increase her working capital. She plans to purchase a larger cooler than she currently has, and wants to purchase grocery stock with cash, thus earning cash discounts as well as volume discounts.

loan.use: to purchase a larger cooler, and to purchase grocery stock with cash, thus earning cash discounts as well as volume discounts.

loan.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Kyambadde lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, all of whom are in school.
Aida has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Eva sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Aida has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.
The main business challenges for Aida include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build rental rooms and also to own a delivery van.
Aida lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loan.name: Plamerdi Plus Group

texts.en:
Jean Claude, aged 49, is the president of the community bank Plamerdi Plus which is composed of 14 members united in solidarity to receive loans from HOPE DRC, a Kiva field partner, with the goal of developing their businesses.
Jean Claude is married and the father of two children who attend school. He runs a cellphone booth and is a money changer. He has been in business since 2000. He manages his cellphone booth in his area located east of the DRC's capital Kinshasa. Each week, he says his business brings in a profit of $70.
Jean Claude is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more prepaid phone cards to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. His ambition is to have his own significant capital.

loan.use: to purchase more prepaid phone cards to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama P. sells food items such as salt, tomatoes, pepper and others at Mfuom near Abura. She is married to a farmer and they live together with seven dependents. She supports her husband to help feed and educate their dependents. She intends to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more food items for sale.

loan.use: to buy more food items for resale, such as salt, tomatoes, and pepper

loan.name: Ndeye Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Bineta S. est une femme qui vit dans la localit de Dalifort. Elle pratique lactivit de commerce plus prcisment la vente de produits cosmtiques. Elle a choisi cette activit pour gagner sa vie. Elle sollicite un crdit de 100 000 frs prvu pour lachat de produits destins renforcer son stock de marchandises. Son objectif est de diversifier ses produits et satisfaire sa clientle. Le financement lui permettra daccroitre ses profits, de subvenir ses propres besoins et aussi de soutenir sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ndeye Bineta S. is a woman who lives in the town of Dalifort. She trades in cosmetics and began this business in order to earn a living. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs in order to buy products and increase her stock. Her objective is to diversify her range of products and satisfy her customers. The loan will allow her to increase her profits, provide for her own needs and support her family.

loan.use: to purchase cosmetics

loan.name: Galo Alfredo

texts.es:
Galo de 59 aos, es un hombre trabajador que vende y confecciona sandalias y zapatillas. Desde muy joven l comenz con la confeccin de zapatillas para independizarse. Poco a poco a comercializado las zapatillas.
Ahora trabaja como comerciante informal vendiendo las zapatillas y confeccionando las zapatillas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas y con elaboracin de otros modelos de zapatillas. Para continuar con su negocio l quiere comprar materias para hacer mas zapatillas como pegamento, cuero, suelas etc.
texts.en: Galo, 59, is a hardworking man who makes and sells sandals and shoes. When he was very young he began making shoes to become independent. Little by little he has marketed his shoes. Now he works as an informal businessman making and selling shoes. He has many dreams with his sales and with making other shoe designs. In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy material such as glue, leather, and soles, to make more shoes.

loan.use: to purchase glue, leather, and soles.

loan.name: Nelson David

texts.es: Nelson, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor de maz, chile y pipin, trabaja en lo propio de lunes a sbado, tiene experiencia en el negocio porque lleva dedicndose 11 aos a la agricultura. Por el momento necesita de un prstamo para la compra de insumos agrcolas como abono y fertilizantes, estos son materiales necesarios para iniciar la siembra. l trabajara con todo el empeo necesario para recibir una buena cosecha, comercializarla a buen precio y tener un margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department. He is a farmer who grows corn, chilis and pipin (a type of squash). He works on his own farm from Monday to Saturday. He has experience in the business because he has been farming for 11 years.
Right now, Nelson needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and fertilizers. These are materials he needs to start his sowing.
Nelson will work his hardest to ensure a good harvest which he will sell for a good price and make a profit margin.

loan.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop

loan.name: Anallely Enriqueta

texts.es: Anallely tiene 24 aos y estudio hasta tercer ao de secundaria y comenta que no continuo con sus estudios porque sus paps no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doa Anallely est casada con el seor Francisco; ellos tienen dos hijas una de 5 aos la cual estudia el preescolar y una de 7 meses. La seora Anallely esta pidiendo un crdito a la financiera para invertir en zapatos por catalogo y ropa para tener en existencia y sus clientas se animen a comprar sus productos por que ella dice de la vista nace el amor por eso quiero que vean los productos y tener en existencia. Ella tiene con este tipo de negocio aproximadamente 3 aos, dice que decidi emprender este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijas y para pagar una casa que compraron de inters social. La meta que tiene es hacer un local en su casa para ella estar mas al pendiente de sus pequeas hijas ella quisiera poner una fonda donde venda comida o una papelera ya que cerca de su casa no lo hay.
texts.en:
Anallely, 24, studied until her third year of secondary school, and says that she did not continue her studies because her parents did not have enough money to continue paying her school expenses. Doa Anallely is married to Sr. Francisco, and they have two daughters. One is 5 and in preschool, and the other is 7 months old.
Anallely is asking for a loan to invest in shoes and clothing from catalogs so she can have them in hand and her clients will get excited about buying her merchandise. She says, "If they see it, they love it. That's why I want them to see the products and have them in hand."
She has been doing this sort of business for about 3 years. She says she decided to start the business in order to help her husband with her daughters' expenses, and to pay for a house that they bought from public housing. Her goal is to have an area in her house where she can watch her little girls. She would like to put in a small eatery where she can sell food or a stationary store since there isn't one near her house.

loan.use: to buy clothing and shoes from catalogs to sell

loan.name: Ayidekon Houeto 2 Group

texts.fr: AYIDEKON HOUETO 2 est un groupement constitu de quatorze personnes et dont la prsidente (celle qui a le doigt lev sur la photo) est nomme Aline. Les membres du groupe vivent ensemble dans le mme quartier Houto dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Dans le but daugmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la premire fois, un crdit auprs de ALID. Ne le 20 Octobre 1973 Cotonou, capitale conomique du Bnin, Aline vit depuis huit ans Abomey Calavi. Aline est marie un employ de bureau du nom de Eugne et a trois enfants, tous scolariss. Aline assure ensemble avec son mari les diffrentes charges de la maison. Aline a arrt l'cole au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture, une activit qu'elle mne depuis quatorze ans et qui lui permet de contribuer aux dpenses familiales. Aline vend galement divers articles de mercerie dans son atelier. Aline achte ses produits Dantokpa, march international du Bnin. Ce premier prt permettra certainement Aline et son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activit et daccrotre leur clientle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
AYIDEKON HOUETO 2 is a group composed on 14 women. The President of the group (the woman with her finger raised in the photograph) is Aline. The members of the group are all from the same neighborhood within the city of Abomey Calavi. With the goal to increase their working capital, the group is requesting a loan from Alid for the first time.
Born on October 20, 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bnin, Aline has lived for eight years in Abomey Calavi. Aline is married to an office worked named Eugne and has three children who are in school. Aline is responsible along with her husband for all the expenses of the household. She dropped out of high-school and then studied sewing, which she has continued for 14 years and enables her to help with the family expenses. Aline also sells a variety of dry goods from her workshop. She buys her products in Dantokpa, an international market in Bnin. This first loan will certainly enable Aline and the group to increase their business, and grow their clientele and revenues.

loan.use: to purchase fabric and dry goods

loan.name: Argemiro

texts.es: Durante varios aos Argemiro se ha dedicado a la cra de animales como perros, peces, gansos, marranos, entre otros. Su trabajo lo desempea en una finca ubicada en el municipio de El Carmen de Viboral en el departamento de Antioquia. Esta finca es patrimonio de gran parte de su familia y por eso trabaja all de domingo a domingo junto con sus hermanos. En la semana se dedica a cuidar a todas las especies y a comercializar los pescados que produce, y los fines de semana esta finca llamada El Lago se convierte en un lugar turstico donde los habitantes del municipio pueden ir a pescar y a pasar una tarde agradable. Para Argemiro su mayor dificultad es tener el cuido suficiente que necesitan sus animales semanalmente; l disfruta de cuidarlos, consentirlos y estar da a da pendiente de su bienestar por lo tanto necesita el capital para comprarles los alimentos adecuados de acuerdo a las especies que cra.
texts.en: For several years Argemiro has raised animals such as dogs, fish, geese, pigs etc. on a farm in the region of El Carmen de Viboral, Antioquia. He works on his family's land together with his brothers, each Sunday. During the week, Argemiro takes care of the animals he raises and sells them, while on weekends his family's property El Lago is opened as a recreation area where local families come to fish on the lake and spend time outdoors. Argemiro has difficulty feeding the animals he raises; for this reason he seeks credit in order to keep them adequately fed.

loan.use: To buy pet food to raise animals

loan.name: Avelina

texts.es: Avelina tiene 52 aos de edad y es originaria de la poblacin de Zitacuaro ubicado en el estado de Michoacn, conocido por que muy cerca de ese lugar esta el santuario de la mariposa monarca. Doa Avi como es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos se dedica a la venta de joyera fina (Oro blanco y amarillo) y esta pidiendo un prstamo a Fundacin Realidad para invertir en la compra de aretes, cadenas, esclavas, anillos. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 7 aos, comenta que empez a vender sus joyas para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y tambin porque se quera sentirse til. Ella surte en la ciudad de Guadalajara. La meta que tiene la seora Avelina es invertir en un local de comida para llevar ya que cerca de su casa esta un hospital y le ira muy bien en ese negocio. Doa Avelina esta casada con el seor Arturo el cual es taxista y tuvieron 2 hijos que ya estn casados. Ella est contenta porque Fundacin Realidad le har el prstamo y porque se le hace poco lo que pagara de intereses en comparacin de otras financieras con las cuales ella ha trabajado y no le gusto, est agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
texts.en:
Avelina is 52 years old and from the town of Zitacuaro which is located in the State of Michoacn. It is well known because it is very close to the Monarch Butterfly sanctuary.
Avi, as she is known to her friends and neighbors, sells jewelry (yellow gold and white gold). She is requesting a loan from Fundacin Realidad to invest in buying earrings, chains, bangles and rings. She has been working in her business for approximately seven years. She tells us that she started selling jewelry to help her husband with their household expenses and also because she wanted to feel useful. She goes out in the city of Guadalajara.
Avelina's goal is to invest in premises for a food business since there is a hospital near her home and such a business would do very well. Avelina is married to Arturo who is a taxi driver. They have two children who are now married. Avelina is happy that Fundacin Realidad will give her this loan and that she won't have to pay much interest compared to what she paid with other loan companies that she worked with and didn't like. She is grateful for the trust that has been placed in her.

loan.use: to buy yellow gold and white gold jewelry

loan.name: Simona Dominga

texts.es: Simona tiene 47 aos, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Se dedica al destace de cerdo y venta tambin vende los derivados del cerdo. Tiene ms 11 aos en este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado que su negocio se mantenga, empezaron desde joven con un pequeo ahorro y actualmente cuenta con ms clientes y siempre es ayudada por su esposo y su hijo. En el futuro desea que pueda terminar una carrera universitaria.Solicita este prstamo para la compra de cerdos y productos para la elaboracin de los derivados de la carne de cerdo. Ya que al proveerles diversidad de productos la clientela tiene mayor opcin para comprar.
texts.en:
Simona is 47 years old and has two children in her care. Her business is slaughtering pigs and selling pork products. She has been in this business for more than 11 years. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, she has managed to keep her business running. She started out when she was a young woman with a small amount of savings and she now has more customers. She is always helped by her husband and her son. In the future, she would like to complete a university degree.
Simona is requesting this loan to buy pigs and supplies for making pork products because if she offers her customers a wide range of products, they have more options to buy.

loan.use: to buy pigs and supplies for making pork products

loan.name: Amalia

texts.es: L. seora Amalia tiene 50 aos D. edad y es originaria D. L. poblacin D. Zitacuaro ubicado en el estado D. Michoacn, un lugar lleno D. historia donD. se considera el mejor clima a nivel mundial. Doa Amalia se dedica a vender productos D. belleza por catalogo y esta pidiendo un prstamo a L. Financiera para invertir en L. compra D. cremas, perfumes, maquillajes, pinturas D. uas etc. ElL. tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 10 aos y empez con este tipo D. negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que tenan barios hijos que dependan D. ellos. ElL. venD. sus productos ms que nada a gente que tiene un sueldo seguro como a maestras, secretarias, en oficinas D. gobierno y D. L. presidencia D. L. poblacin ya que elL. venD. sus productos en pagos y as no le quedan mal. Surte sus productos en L. poblacin D. Tuxpan Michoacn en una distribuidora autorizada, elL. esta casada con el seor Jos Lus el cual es jubilado y viven ellos solos ya que sus hijos son cados. L. meta que tiene doa Amalia es hacer un local en frente D. su casa elL. quisiera poner un negocio D. abarrotes que es mximo sueo y elL. confa que poco a poco ahorrara para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Amalia is 50 years old and from the town of Zitacuaro, in the State of Michoacn. This place is full of history and is considered to have the best climate in the world.
Amalia's business is selling beauty products through catalogs. She is requesting a loan to invest in buying creams, perfume, makeup, nail polish, etc. She has been in this business for approximately 10 years. She started out in this type of business in order to help her husband with their household expenses since they had several children who depended on them. Amalia sells her products mainly to people with a secure wage such as teachers, secretaries and government workers in the town. She sells her products on credit to suit her customers. She stocks up with products in the town of Tuxpan, Michoacn, from an authorized distributor.
Amalia is married to Jos Lus, who is retired, and they live alone because their children are already married. Amalia's goal is to set up a sales location in the front part of her home. She would like to set up a grocery business. This is her biggest dream and she is confident that she will gradually save up enough money to fulfil her dream.

loan.use: to sell beauty products through catalogs

loan.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 46 aos de edad, est casada con el seor Patricio quien es profesor de una escuela primaria, ellos tienen 4 hijos, pero vive nada mas con ellos su hija que es madre soltera y su nieto llamado Santiago de 4 aos de edad el cual doa Lety se hizo cargo de l desde que naci ya que su hija estaba estudiando y en estos momentos trabaja como contadora. Doa Lety est pidiendo su prstamo para invertir en su negocio de joyera fina (oro) ella se surte en la cuidad de Morolen Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad le dan buenos precios ya que es clienta desde hace 12 aos y a los cuales ella les puede subir un poco y no dar tan cara su joyera . Ella comenta que le est echando muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que quiere que su hijo que estudiando leyes pueda terminar su carrera y pueda comprarle los libros que el ocupa. Ahorita uno de sus propsitos es aclientarse y vender agente que no le quede mal en sus pagos, ms que nada personas que tengan un trabajo estable, y uno de sus sueos es rentar un local y establecerse ya que es muy peligroso traer joyas finas en la calle, tambin uno de sus sueos es poder remodelar su casa ya que en tiempo de lluvia se le trasmina el agua.
texts.en:
Leticia is 46 years old and is married to Patricio who is an elementary school teacher. They have four children but only their daughter (a single mother) and their grandson Santiago, who is 4 years old, live with them. Lety has taken care of Santiago since he was born since her daughter was studying and now she works as an accountant.
Lety is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling fine (gold) jewelry. She buys her stock in the city of Morolen Guanajuato since they offer her good prices in that city because she has been a customer for 12 years. She can then raise the price just a little and not have to sell her jewelry for too high a price. She tells us that she is putting a lot of effort into her work since she wants her son, who is studying Law, to be able to finish his degree and she wants to be able to buy him the textbooks he needs.
Right now, one of Leticia's goals is to attract customers and sell to people who will be able to meet all their payments, above all people who have stable jobs. One of her dreams is to hire premises and set her business up there since it is very dangerous to carry fine jewelry in the street. Another one of her dreams is to repair her home since it leaks during the rainy season.

loan.use: to buy fine (gold) jewelry

loan.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es originaria de la poblacin de Zitacuaro, un lugar lleno de historia y hermoso en sus paisajes y que se considera como una de las ciudades con mejor clima a nivel mundial. Ella esta casada con el seor Ral el cual es oficinista en una empresa en Texas E.U.A. desde hace 7 aos y en las vacaciones de diciembre y abril viene a ver a su familia, ellos tienen 5 hijos pero nada mas dos dependen de ellos los cuales estudian en la cuidad de Morelia Michoacn en la universidad. Doa Lupita como es conocida en su localidad, tiene un negocio de renta de computadoras, ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 aos y comenta que puso ese negocio por que una de sus hijas ya no quiso estudiar y le puso el negocio para que se pusiera hacer algo. Doa Lupita pidi un prstamo a la financiera para la compra de papel para imprimir, cartuchos de tinta, discos y guarda dinero por si alguna de las computadoras se le descompone para darles mantenimiento, doa Lupita tiene su local en su casa y la meta que tiene ella es comprar otras dos computadoras y poner una zapatera en su casa ya que a ella le gustan mucho los zapatos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is from the town of Zitacuaro. This is a place which is full of history and has beautiful landscapes. It is considered to be one of the cities with the best climate in the world.
Guadalupe is married to Ral who has been an office worker with a company in Texas, USA, for 7 years. During the December and April vacations he comes to see his family. The couple have five children but only two still depend on them. They are studying at university in the city of Morelia, Michoacn. Lupita, as she is known in her town, has a business renting out computers. She has had this business for approximately 6 years and she tells us that she set up the business because one of her daughters didn't want to study any more. She set up the business so that she would have something to do.
Lupita requested this loan to buy printing paper, ink cartridges and disks and also so that she could put some money aside in case one of her computers breaks down and she needs to do repair work. Lupita's premises are in her home and her goal is to buy another two computers and to set up a shoe store in her home since she really likes shoes.

loan.use: to maintain her Internet caf

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente 1 ao Alejandra comenz con su propio negocio fabricando y comercializando productos de joyera, labor que aprendi gracias al apoyo de su hermano quien le financi un curso de capacitacin. Trabaja desde su casa fabricando y vendiendo estos productos y aunque no tiene un horario fijo es consiente que trabajando constantemente no slo las ventas se van a aumentar si no que la produccin va a crecer proporcionalmente.
Alejandra necesita capital para comprar insumos y materias primas y as tener un mayor inventario que le permita optimizar sus porcentajes de venta. A futuro desea tener un taller donde cree sus propios accesorios y pueda sacar nuevas colecciones; al mismo tiempo desea convertirse en proveedora de insumos de otras personas que realizan el mismo oficio.
texts.en:
About a year ago Alejandra started her own business making and commercializing jewelry. She learned this craft thanks to the support of her brother who paid for a training course. Alejandra works from home, making and selling these products, and, though she does not have a fixed schedule, she knows that if she works continuously, not only will the sales go up, but also the production will increase proportionally.
Alejandra needs capital in order to purchase supplies and raw materials which would allow her to have a larger inventory and optimize her sales margins. In the future, she would like to have a workshop where she could create her own accessories and new collections. At the same time, Alejandra is also hoping to become a supplier of raw materials to others in the jewelry business.

loan.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies

loan.name: Vaginak

texts.en:
Vaginak is 39 years old and lives in the village of Khospio, Akhalkalaki District. He is married and has three children (14, 12 and 9 years old). All of them go to school. Vaginaks wife Shoghik works as a teacher in a local school.
Vaginak earns a living growing potatoes. The family owns agricultural land with an area of 1.3 ha, which is used for potato growing. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to wholesalers. As this region is well-known throughout the country for its good-quality potatoes, Vaginak never has problem selling the harvest.
Vaginak requested from Credo an agricultural loan in the amount of 1,500 Laris. With this money he will purchase potato seeds. He hopes that he will have a good season and get the planned amount of harvest. The profit earned will be used for covering the familys daily expenses.

loan.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora que ha dedicado toda su vida a confeccionar prendas de vestir; aprendi el oficio hace 40 aos gracias a una prima quien se encarg de ensearle y desde entonces se ha dedicado a saber ms acerca de la confeccin.
Trabaja da a da de 7a.m. a 6p.m debido a que tiene gran cantidad de pedidos por entregar, sin embargo el tiempo a veces no le es suficiente puesto que Yolanda necesita una mquina plana para agilizar la produccin.
