With the loan she wants to buy school supplies and general paper products to improve her income. In the future she wants to expand her paper goods business and help her husband with his butcher shop, so that they can build a second story onto their home.

loan.use: to buy school supplies and stationary

loan.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella es separada y tiene 44 aos y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida y tambin se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y chanchos, el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en el mercado de Andahuaylillas,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos pequeos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de venta de comida y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y alimentos para los animales.
Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de leche, tienda de abarrotes, venta de chicha, tcnico electricista, mecnico y venta de pasto.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the village bank "Los Comerciantes de Andahuaylillas". This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, which is in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.
One member, Mrs. Higidia, is 44 years old, separated and has 5 children. She sells food and also raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She sells food in the market of Andahuaylillas, working from 7:00am until 2:00pm. With these small businesses, she helps her children to get ahead. She wants to increase and improve her food sales and animal husbandry businesses. She asks for the loan to buy cooking products and animal feed.
The other members sell milk, run grocery stores, sell chicha [a local beverage], work as electricians and mechanics and sell pasture.
She thanks those who are part of her dream by this means, and promises to comply with the payments in the established time period.

loan.use: to buy cooking products and animal feed

loan.name: Ana Regina

texts.es: Ana Regina es socia del Banco Comunal Victor echave, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 aos de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos (2 independientes). Cuenta con estudios de educacin secundaria. La seora se dedica a la venta de artculos artesanales y a la venta de comidas, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ao. Su prstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirti en su negocio de artesanas. Ana solicitar un nuevo prstamo por la suma de S/1300.00 nuevo soles, con ste dinero comprar 4 kilos de lana para la fabricacin de chompas y chalecos. Trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja en la mina. Su sueo es abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer muchos productos de primera necesidad. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad
texts.en: Ana Regina is a member of the "Victor Echave" Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 56 years old and married by common-law with four children, two of whom are living on their own. She has a high school education. She works selling handicrafts as well as food. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her handicrafts business. Ana is applying for a new loan for 1,300 nuevo soles with which she plans to buy four kilos of yarn in order to make sweaters and vests. She is the only one who works for her business. Her husband works in mining. Her dream is to open a grocery store where she can sell basic necessities. What Ana likes about the communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the responsibility involved.

loan.use: to by 4 kilos of yarn for making sweaters and vests.

loan.name: Favian

texts.es: Favian de 41 Aos de edad, est casado con Marcelina de 35 aos y fruto de esa relacin concibieron 04 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad de Villa el Salvador Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. La labor que realiza Favian es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantas de caf y pltano, en total cuenta con 03 hectreas de terreno. Aprendi el trabajo del campo en las tierras de sus padres quienes le ensearon a remover la tierra y creci con los anhelos de poseer su propia parcela. Ahora con sus ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propio terreno, es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 22 aos y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano disfruta de la calidad de los frutos de su sembro las cuales son muy cotizadas en los puntos de venta. Menciona adems que lo ms difcil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas, por lo cual Favian solicita el crdito para la compra de insecticidas para combatir las plagas que asechan sus cultivos; en lo futuro comprara ms tierras para aumentar su produccin. Este es su segundo crdito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora tambin. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprar insecticidas para fumigar la plaga que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Favian, 41 years old, is married to Marcelina, 35, and together they have 4 children. They live together in their own home located in the community of Villa el Salvador Anexo in the district of Kimbiri.
Favian works the land where they grow coffee and plantains on a total of 3 hectares. He learned how to work in the field on his parents' land, who taught him how to remove the dirt. His desire to own his own parcel of land grew. Now with his accumulated savings he was able to fulfill this desire for his own land. He is familiar with hard work in the fields. He has been doing it for 22 years, and during harvest time he has help from his children and seasonal workers. He feels very committed to his work, since thanks to his daily efforts he is able to enjoy quality fruits from his plantings which are sought-after in the food stalls.
He also mentions that the hardest part is guarding his crops from insects, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy insecticides to combat the plagues that stalk his crops. In the future he will buy more land to increase his production. This is his second loan with MFP. He has been very punctual with his payments and expects to continue to be so. With the 1000 nuevos soles that he has requested, he will buy insecticides to fumigate the insects that threaten his crops.

loan.use: to buy insecticides

loan.name: Priscila Iluminada

texts.es:
Priscila de 53 aos, es una mujer trabajadora que empez su actividad cocinando en un restaurant. Poco a poco reuni un capital y abri su propio local de comida.
En la actualidad trabaja diariamente con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. Le dificulta en su trabajo la competencia y la delincuencia. Con el prstamo va a comprar arroz, aceite, legumbre para su negocio de comida para as tener un mayor rendimiento en su comedor. En un futuro quiere abrir otro local de comida y comprarse su vehculo.
texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old. She is a hard-working woman who began her work cooking in a restaurant. Gradually, she got together money and opened her own restaurant.
Currently, she works daily with the help of her husband and children. The difficulty in her work is competition and crime. With this loan, she is going to buy rice, oil, vegetables for her restaurant business in order to have greater yield with her diner. In the future, she wishes to open another location and buy herself a car.

loan.use: to buy rice, oil and vegetables.

loan.name: Asunta Sofia

texts.es: Asunta es socia del Banco Comunal Las Retamas, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 aos de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes). Asunta tiene educacin secundaria. Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres aos. Su primer prstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utiliz en su negocio de venta al por menor de productos lcteos-leche. La seora solicitar un nuevo prstamo por la suma de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizar para comprar quesos y leche para luego venderlos a sus clientes, tambin cuenta que trabaja en la agricultura. Su sueo es mejorar el negocio y obtener ms ingresos. Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the "Las Retamas" community bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has six children (two of whom are adults). Asunta has a high school education.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan was for 300 new "soles", money that she used in her business selling dairy and milk products at retail.
She will request a new loan in the sum of 400 new "soles" which will be used to buy cheeses and milk to then sell to her customers that work in farming. Her dream is to improve her business and obtain more income. What she likes about her community bank are the training and lectures.

loan.use: to purchase cheeses and milk.

loan.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Joe G. and his wife, Sylvia, own a sports bar called Joes Hide Out. They offer cold beer and snacks, as well as a friendly atmosphere where anybody can get to know everybody. Open Tuesday through Sunday from 11 in the morning to 12 at night, it is closed Monday so that Jose and Sylvia can spend time with Joses elderly mother. As Sylvia says, Our customers are our friends and family. Their loyal clientele includes locals as well as Winter Texans who come from as far away as Canada to spend winters in the small town of Donna in the Rio Grande Valley.
In 2003, Joe acquired the bar from an elderly man wanting to retire. In order to work the bar, Joe took a temporary leave of absence from H-E-B, a Texas grocery store where he had worked for eighteen years. At the end of three months, Joe realized that he loved owning the bar and resigned from H-E-B. Joe and Sylvia live in a house across the street from the bar. They work hard to make Joes Hide Out a fun place to be.
Every day, Joe and his wife serve free "botana" (snacks) like squash and chicken, beef and potatoes, and hot dogs. Recognizing their generosity, customers sometimes pitch in to help cover the cost. Even when that doesnt happen, Joe and Sylvia believe it is worth it, because it is fun and attracts business.
Another tradition at Joes Hide Out is the rule is that whoever rings the bell must buy a round for everyone in the bar. Sometimes Joe rings the bell, which gets the customers excited and typically leads to their buying rounds for each other. On the weekends, Jose, Sylvia, and their friends and customers barbecue on their outside grill. They have musicians come and play music while customers eat, drink, and dance on the patio.
This is Joe and Sylvias second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana. With their first loan, they expanded the bar, added pool tables, and bought a television. With this loan, they will fix the bars air conditioner and repair their parking lot.

loan.use: to fix the air conditioning and pave the parking lot.

loan.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Cosme; ella es conviviente y tiene 41 aos y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artefactos y ropa, ella tiene una tienda donde vende artefactos y ropa de segunda mano, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y artefactos de segunda mano. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar ropa y artefactos.
Los otros socios se dedican la venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de ropa.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Moyopata-San Sebastian community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.
The member is Cosme. She lives with her partner, is 41 years old and has five children. She works at her business selling artifacts and clothing. She has a store where she sells second-hand artifacts and clothing. She works from 9AM until 6PM and through this business, she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand her business selling second-hand clothing and artifacts. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing and artifacts.
The other members are dedicated to selling food, vegetables, a grocery store and selling clothing.
The member is thankful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and promises to make the repayments at the established deadlines.

loan.use: to buy clothes and artifacts.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy tools.

loan.name: Julian

texts.es: Julin, natural de la ciudad de Huanta, tiene 47 Aos de edad, est casado con Emiliana de 45 aos y fruto de esa relacin tienen hoy 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Sampantuari Alta Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. Julin es el sustento de toda su familia y se esmera cada da por dar el mejor bienestar a sus seres queridos, Julin desde muy nio labraba la tierra de sus padres y creci con esos dotes. Cuando conoci a su esposa decidi comprar sus propias tierras y desde ese entonces sus sembros son plantas de cacao, frutas ctricas, pias y hojas de coca donde viene trabajando 25 aos de manera independiente. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos hasta sus caseros para luego mercantilizar a los compradores. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, as obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la estacin de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor precipitaciones de lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza daando sus cultivos y perdiendo en mayor cantidad los frutos de sus cultivos. Julin solicita el crdito para comprar sus herramientas de trabajo como machetes, tijeras de poda y entre otros, Pero ahora lo que ms prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras y diseminar ms plantas de caf. Este es su primer prstamo con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podr acceder a otro prstamo con mayor tranquilidad; agradece a la institucin por concederle el prstamo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprar herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Julin, native of the city of Huanta, is 47 years old and is married to Emiliana, who is 45, and, fruit of this relationship, they have today five children and together they live in their own house located in the community of Sampantuari Alta Anexo in the district of Kimbiri. Julin is the support of the whole family and he works everyday to improve the wellbeing of his dear family. Julin, since he was young, worked the land of his parents and grew up with those skills.
When he met his wife, he decided to buy his own land and since then his crops have been cocoa plants, citrus fruits, pineapple and coca leaves. He's been working for 25 years independently. At harvest time, he counts on the support of his children and laborers who are in charge of harvesting and transporting the fruit to their villages to then sell to the buyers. He feels very committed to his work. Thanks to his daily efforts, today, he enjoys seeing these crops and good earnings. He says that winter is not welcome because they are months where large rainfall is abundant damaging his crops and losing a great quantity of fruit crops. Julin is requesting the loan to buy tools like machetes, pruning scissors, among others. But now, what takes priority is buying new land and planting more coffee plants. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that if he pays on time, he will be able to access another loan with greater ease. He is thankful to the institution to grant this loan. With the 3,000 new "soles" requested, he will buy tools for his work.

loan.use: to buy tools for his farming job.

loan.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
La Seora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de Santa Catalina en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronoma, su gente se dedica al comercio, cra de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazn muy calido.
Doa Rosa tiene 38 aos, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y 10 aos de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y la segunda en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesin chofer y labora conduciendo volquetas, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad y es el fruto del esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
La Seora. Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 3 aos, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la maana hasta las 8 de la noche. Trabaja tambin en sus viveros en donde siembra una gran variedad de plantas para la venta y cra animales como pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su propio sector.
Es el tercer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azcar, detergentes, aceites, embutidos y ms productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
Su meta es crecer mucho ms en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Seora Rosa C. is a member of the communal bank Siempre Amigas. She lives in the Santa Catalina community in the parish of Valle. This parish has beautiful landscapes and a wide variety of cuisines. The people are here work in business, agriculture and the raising of animals. The people are friendly and warm-hearted.
Doa Rosa is 38 years old, married and has 2 daughters, ages 16 and 10. Both girls attend school in the city. Her husband makes a living as a dump truck driver. They own their own house which is the fruit of their marital working efforts.
Seora Rosa has had a grocery store for 3 years. She works 7 days a week from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. She also works in her nursery where she grows a wide variety of plants that she sells as well as raising animals like chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her area.
This is her third loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products with which to stock her store.
Her goal is to expand her businesses.

loan.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products.

loan.name: Ruperto Lirio

texts.es:
Ruperto de 59 aos, es un hombre trabajador que inicio su negocio con poca mercadera el escogi es actividad por que le gustaba estar en la tienda.
En la actualidad trabaja todos los das de 7H00am a 10H00pm. Est casado y ella es ama de casa tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad uno de ellos le ayuda en la tienda. Con el prstamo va a comprar arroz, confites, bebidas gaseosas. Lo que anhela es seguir en el negocio para tener prosperidad para su familia
texts.en:
Ruperto is 59 years old. He is a hardworking man who started his business with a little merchandise. He chose this business because he liked being in the store.
At present, he works every day from 7:00 am to 10:00 p.m. He is married and she is a housewife. They have three grown children and one of them helps at the store. With the loan, he is going to buy rice, candies and soft drinks. What he longs for is for his business to prosper for his family.

loan.use: to buy rice, candies, and soft drinks.

loan.name: J. Refugio

texts.en:
J. Refugio G. is an independent truck driver who started RGE Transport in January, 2011. Having been in the trucking industry for many years, Refugio finally decided to go into business for himself. He contracts with a transportation company that specializes in moving fruits and vegetables. Originally from Guanajuato, Refugio moved to Edinburg in 1993.
Refugio used this loan to help buy his truck. He was referred to ACCION Texas-Louisiana by the truck dealer who sold him his trailer. Without this loan, Refugio doesnt know when he would have been able to buy his truck and launch his business.
Within a few years, Refugio would like to buy more trailers to expand his business. Echanle ganas! His advice to fellow entrepreneurs is, Go for it, and open your business! With dedication, everything is possible.

loan.use: to buy a truck for his business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 25 aos, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Ral de 37 aos y sus 02 queridos hijos, lo que ms desea es brindar una buena educacin a sus hijos, para lo cual est dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Con mucho esfuerzo Rayda ha logrado abrir su tienda de bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, y helados, por lo cual se esmera por brindar una buena comodidad a sus clientes, es as que los fines de semana es muy concurrido su local por los pobladores de su zona quienes despus de realizar sus deportes favoritos se ponen a degustar las bebidas heladas. Lleva 02 aos en este negocio y le va muy bien. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio y comprar ms congeladoras y as mantener sus bebidas refrigeradas. Este es su primer prstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro prstamo posteriormente. Agradece a la institucin por concederle el prstamo. Con el crdito solicitado comprar una maquina fotocopiadora y prestar servicio de fotocopias a los alumnos de diferentes centros educativos ya que tiene espacio suficiente para montar este negocio.
texts.en:
Rayda, age 25, is a very friendly and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her life partner, 37 year old Ral, and their two beloved children. What she wants most of all is to give her children a good education. In order to do this she is prepared to work very hard.
With great effort Rayda has managed to open a store with drinks like soft drinks, beer, and frozen drinks. She does her best to make her customers very comfortable. That is why her place is very busy on the week-ends. The villagers in the area come to enjoy frozen drinks after they play their favorite sport. She has had this business for two years, and it is going very well for her.
In the future she wishes to expand her business. She wants to buy more freezers in order to keep the drinks refrigerated.
This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time if she wishes to get another loan later on. She is grateful to the institution for granting the loan. She will use the requested loan to buy a photocopy machine. She will provide photocopy services to the students in different educational centers because she has enough space to start up this business.

loan.use: to buy a photocopier

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Flor de Canela, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 aos de edad. Est casada y tiene 2 hijos. Carmen cuenta con educacin secundaria completa. Su esposo es empleado pblico. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de todo tipo por catlogo, hace seis aos trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer prstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utiliz en su negocio. En la actualidad solicitar un nuevo prstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizar para comprar productos de belleza marca Esika y Avon, comprar perfumes, desodorantes, aretes, etc. Su sueo es poder vivir bien, crecer como empresaria y tener xitos en la familia. Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la confraternidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Flor de Canela (Cinnamon Flower) Communal Bank. It is located in the Puno district, in the Puno province and district. She is 56 years old, married, and has two children. Carmen has a high school education. Her husband is a public employee.
She sells all types of beauty products by catalog. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it in her business.
She will currently request a loan for 1,000 soles to buy Esika and Avon brands of beauty products. She will buy perfume, deodorant, and earrings, etc.
Her dream is to be able to live well, to grow as a businesswoman, and for her family to be successful. What she likes about her communal bank is the camaraderie among the members.

loan.use: to buy perfume, deodorant, and earrings, etc.

loan.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN NATIVIDAD; Este banco est ubicado en el poblado de Yucay, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; es soltera, la socia tiene 44 aos de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos 2 independientes, tiene otros 2 de (16, 10), la socia se dedica principalmente a la artesana, la socia elabora todo tipo de artesana en la puerta del hotel sonesta posada en Yucay, la socia vende guantes, coreas de lana con aplicaciones, chalinas, mantillas, mantas, gorros y todo hecho en lana de oveja, alpaca y lana sinttica, la socia e esta ocasin solicita el prstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la confeccin de los diferentes tejidos. La socia solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y otros para elaborar sus trabajos.
La socia est muy agradecida por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho prstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Virgen Natividad Community Bank. This bank is located in the Yucay village in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.
Lorenza is 44 years old, single, and has four children. Two of her children are independent, and the other two are 16 and 10 years old.
She devotes herself primarily to making handicrafts. She makes all types of handicrafts in the doorway of the Sonesta Posada Hotel in Yucay. She sells gloves, wool belts with appliques, scarves, lace scarves, blankets, and hats. Everything is made from wool from sheep and alpacas and synthetic wool.
She is now requesting a loan to be able to buy materials for making her different knitted products. She is requesting the loan to buy wool and other things to make her pieces of work.
She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loan.use: to buy wool and other supplies to make her products

loan.name: Justo Martin

texts.es:
Justo de 41 aos, es un hombre emprendedor que decidi escoger esa actividad de vender fruta como lo haca su padre. Tiene 20 aos de experiencia recorriendo la ciudad vendiendo frutas.
Labora de lunes a sbados de 6H00 am a 6H00 pm. su esposa trabaja vendiendo bisutera en un local de la baha. Con el prstamo desea comprar ms mercadera para su negocio como naranjas sandia zapote, etc. e incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro comprarse una camioneta para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Justo, age 41, is an enterprising man who decided to go into the business of selling fruit, as his father did. He has 20 years of experience as a mobile vendor selling fruit in the town.
He works from Monday through Saturday, 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. His wife works selling costume jewelry in a shop at the waterfront market. With the loan, he would like to buy more merchandise for his business, such as oranges, watermelons, sapotes, etc., so he can increase his earnings. in the future, he wants to buy a small truck so that he can have a better life with his family.

loan.use: to buy oranges, watermelons and sapotes to sell.

loan.name: Christian Eduardo

texts.es:
Christian de 31 aos, es un hombre trabajador gracias a la ayuda de su mama pudo comprarse un vehculo con el cual trabaja como taxista, escogi esta actividad debido a que no encontraba trabajo.
En la actualidad trabaja solo desde las 6H00am hasta las 21H00pm. le afecta mucho la delincuencia ya que la ciudad se ha vuelto peligrosa. Con el prstamo va a darle mantenimiento al vehculo para as no tener problemas con el tiempo y as seguir incrementando sus ganancias. Ya que en un futuro quiere obtener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Christian, age 31, is a hard-working man. Thanks to help from his mother, he was able to buy a vehicle which he uses to work as a taxi driver. He chose this business because he did not find a job.
Currently, he works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 9 p.m. He is strongly affected by crime, because the city has become dangerous. With the loan, he will carry out maintenance on his vehicle, so that he will not have problems over time. This will help him continue to increase his earnings, since in the future he wants to obtain a house of his own.

loan.use: to pay for tires and maintenance.

loan.name: Clemencia Beneranda

texts.es:
La Seora. Clemencia P. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de La Gloria en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronoma, su gente se dedica al comercio, cra de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazn muy calido.
La Seora. Clemencia tiene 45 aos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 12 aos de edad y todos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su taller de carpintera, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
Doa Clemencia tiene una sastrera en su casa, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja de domingo a domingo. Ella aprendi corte y confeccin en una academia y ahora realiza todo tipo de costuras.
Est en el banco comunal hace 2 aos y tiene una gran amistada con todas las socias, el dinero de su crdito lo va a invertir una parte para la compra de tela y tambin para la realizacin de la tesis de grado de su hijo.
Su meta es tener un taller mucho ms grande.
texts.en:
Clemencia P. is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" ["Forever Friends"] communal bank. She lives in the community of La Gloria, in Del Valle parish. This parish has beautiful scenery and a varied cuisine. Its people are dedicated to trade, raising animals, and agriculture. They are friendly people with very warm hearts.
Clemencia is 45 years old and married, with 3 children aged 17, 15 and 12, all of whom are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. With the work of both spouses, they have been able to build their own home.
Clemencia has a tailoring shop in her home. She does not have fixed working hours, and she works every day from Sunday to Sunday. She learned how to cut and tailor clothing at an academy, and now she makes all types of garments..
She has been in the communal bank for 2 years, and she has a great friendship with all of the members. The funds from her loan will be invested in part in buying fabric, and also for the expenses related to her son's graduation thesis.
Her goal is to have a much larger tailoring workshop.

loan.use: to buy fabric and pay expenses for her son's graduation thesis.

loan.name: Paula Cecilia

texts.es:
Paula de 32 aos, es una mujer emprendedora que inicio su actividad hace 10 aos en vista que tuvo que ayudar a su familia debido a que su padre falleci. Su negocio le a servido para suplir en algo las necesidades bsicas de su casa.
El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio normalmente lo atiende todo el da, los fines de semana vende comida en la esquina de su casa su mama le ayuda en el trabajo. Lo que ms le afecta es la movilizacin ya que se quiere comprar un vehculo para facilitarle en la comprar de mercadera. Con el prstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos, herramientas de costura para aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro poder tener una vivienda propia ya que donde vive le pertenece a su mama y la divide en varios familiares.
texts.en:
Paula, 32, is an enterprising woman that started her activity ten years ago, knowing that she had to help her family because her father passed away. Her business has helped her provide some of her homes basic needs. Paula's business is based in her home and she usually tends to it all day. On the weekends she sells food on the corner of her home, with her mother's help.
What affects Paula most is mobility, so she wants to buy a vehicle to help her purchase her merchandise. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise which will allow her to increase her income. In the future she wants proper housing, since she lives with her mother and shares the home with several family members.

loan.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and sewing tools

loan.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN NATIVIDAD; Este banco est ubicado en el poblado de Yucay, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; es soltero, la socia tiene 20 aos de edad, el socio se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, el socio siembra maz, verduras el socio segn la poca siembra todo tipo de verduras entre las que encontramos repollo, zanahorias, zapallo, y otras; el socio desea comprar fertilizantes, semillas y abono, el socio tiene su terreno y ahora en esta nueva etapa el socio desea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sembrar nuevamente maz. El socio solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abono.
El socio est muy agradecido por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho prstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN NATIVIDAD. This bank is located in the settlement of Yucay, the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.
The member is Mr. Jose Luis. He is single and 20 years old. The member primarily works in agriculture planting corn and vegetables. Depending on the season, the member plants all types of vegetables including cabbage, carrots, squash and others. The member wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and manure. The member has his land and in this new season the member wants to invest in buying fertilizers and manure to plant corn again. The member is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and manure.
The member is very thankful for the loan and promises to complete his payments on the loan in a disciplined manor.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loan.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Mara de 60 aos, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su negocio de papelera con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
Labora sola en horacios de 07H30am a 18H00pm. Su esposo trabaja de cerrajero. La dificultad en su negocio es la delincuencia que es muy frecuente por el lugar. Con el prstamo va a comprar articulo par su papelera as aumentar sus negocios. En un futuro quiere tener un negocio y estable.
texts.en: Maria, age 60, is a hardworking woman who started her own stationary store business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She works alone from 7:30am till 8pm. Her husband is a locksmith. The main difficulty for her business is the high crime rate in her neighborhood. Maria will use the loan to purchase inventory for her stationary store in order to expand her business. In the future, she is hoping to have an established and profitable store.

loan.use: to purchase inventory for a stationary store

loan.name: Maria Orfelinda

texts.es:
Mara tiene 31 aos de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el casero Punto cuatro, Sialupe , un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a ms de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 aos. Ella cra animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al pblico en general. Adicionalmente Mara ella tiene un pequeo establecimiento desde hace 4 aos en su domicilio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento econmico de su familia.
Mara desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas, asi tambin comprar algunos productos para su bodega. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria, age 31, is married and lives with her husband and her two children in the Punto cuatro settlement in the Sialupe district -- a district populated by humble and hardworking people who make their living through agriculture. Sialupe is part of the Lambayeque province; it is located about forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.
Maria grows barnyard fowl and small farm animals; she has been in this line of work for over ten years. She grows her animals in the backyard of her home and when they reach a good level of development, she sells them to the local merchants as well as to the general public. In addition, for about four years, Maria has had a small convenience store in her home where she sells groceries and basic necessity products. This business allows her to cover her personal expenses and helps with the financial needs of her household.
Maria would like to purchase some additional animals and balanced animal feed in order to increase her sales; she would also like to purchase some inventory for her convenience store. For this reason, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loan.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loan.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORILAZO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 25 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de empanadas, ella prepara las empanadas de carne y pollo y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de empanadas. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar insumos como harina, pollo, carne y manteca para preparar las empanadas.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee, age 25, lives with her partner and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank QORILAZO; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province which is located in the department of Cusco.
Haydee divides her time between her daily activities and her empanada business (empanada is a South American stuffed bread/pastry). She prepares meat and chicken empanadas and then sells them around the neigborhood from 8am to 1pm. This business provides the income Maria needs to raise her children.
Maria would like to expand her empanada business and she is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter that are necessary for the preparation of empanadas. She is very happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loan.use: to purchase ingredients (such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter) necessary for the preparation of empanadas

loan.name: Dorian Danilo

texts.es:
El seor Dorian es un cliente de 26 aos, es empleado en una empresa de perforacin de pozo profundo para riego, habita en calidad de inquilino en la zona oeste de la ciudad de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba. El seor Dorian presta sus servicios en calidad de ayudante perforista en la empresa San Rafael Hidro, quienes se dedican a la perforacin de pozos de agua para riego en las areas rurales del departamento de Cochabamba. Su actual vivienda cuenta con los servicios bsicos completos.
El crdito que solicita el seor Dorian es para la construccin de una habitacin sobre un lote de terreno que tienen en calidad de herencia, de esta manera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que no tendrn que pagar alquileres
texts.en:
Dorian is a borrower who is 26 years old. He is an employee of a company that drilles deep wells for irrigation. He lives as a tenant in the western zone of the city in Cercado province, in the department of Cochabamba.
Dorian provides his services as a drilling assistant for the San Rafael Hidro company, which drills water wells for irrigation in the rural areas of the department of Cochabamba.
His current housing has all of the basic utility services.
The loan Dorian is requesting is to build a dwelling on a plot of land which he has inherited. In this way, he will be able to improve his living conditions, since he will not have to pay rent.

loan.use: to build a dwelling to live in.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA; Este banco est ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vilma; es casada, la socia tiene 34 aos de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9, 5 aos de edad, la socia se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y siendo esta zona conocida como tierra sagrada por tener los granos de maz grandes y dulces, ellos producen el mejor maz de Per para exportacin, la socia siembra y cosecha maz, y vende en jora para elaborar la famosa bebida inka, la chicha de jora. La socia solicita el prstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra de maz.
La socia est muy agradecido por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho prstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA community bank which is located in the village of Rumichaca, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Vilma is 34 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 5. Vilma's main business activity is farming and she owns her own farmland. This area is known as sacred land because they grow the biggest and sweetest corn kernels. They produce the best corn in Peru for export. Vilma sows and harvests corn and sells jora corn which is used to make the famous Incan drink 'chicha de jora'.
Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop. She is very grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loan.use: to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop

loan.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar es padre de familia de 2 pequeos a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo el seor adquiri una vivienda de inters social que por lo regular son muy pequeas y la fachada que tienen son muy sencillas, este crdito ser el tercero que tramita en esta institucin donde ha demostrado una buen historial de crediticio y agradece el apoyo brindado por que con estos crditos ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Omar ahora en este prstamo desea remodelar la parte de enfrente de su casa y para esto necesita comprar material de construccin y pintura para darle hacerle una bonita fachada y diferente al que su hogar
texts.en:
Omar is the father of two young children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life. Some time ago, Omar acquired a house through a government-subsidized housing program. These houses are generally very small and the exteriors are very simple. This loan will be the third that Omar has had from this institution. He has a good credit history and he is grateful for the support that he has been given through these loans which have enabled him to carry out his projects.
Omar would like to use this loan to remodel the front of his house. He needs to buy building supplies and paint so that he can make the front of his home look nice.

loan.use: to remodel the front of his home

loan.name: Nuevas Amigas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas est formado por 1 socio y 8 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economa de sus hogares. Viven por diferentes parroquias y sectores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima fri, tiene hermosos paisajes naturales para visitar, es la tercera ciudad de mas importante del pas y fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, toda su gente es muy amable y cordial.
La Seorita. Diana C. se encuentra en el primer crdito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa del banco.
Nuestra socia tiene 19 aos de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus abuelitos a quienes les ayuda econmicamente.
La Seorita. Diana estudio 2 aos en una academia de costura y est ejerciendo su profesin hace un ao, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la maana hasta las 6 de la tarde en una fbrica que confeccionan jeans.
Su crdito lo va a invertir en la compra de vveres para su hogar.
Su meta es tener un taller de confeccin para producir sus propios productos.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) community bank has nine members (one man and eight women). They all work in different businesses which allow them to contribute financially to their households. They live in different parishes and sectors of the city of Cuenca. This is a cold-climate city which has beautiful natural landscapes to visit. It is the third most important city in the country and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999. Its people are all very kind and friendly.
Diana C. is receiving her first loan through the community bank. She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member of the bank.
Diana is 19 years old and single. She lives in her grandparents' home and helps them out financially. She studied for two years in a sewing academy and she has been carrying out her profession for one year. She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, in a factory where they make jeans.
Diana will use her loan to buy food for her household. Her goal is to own a dressmaking workshop so that she can make her own products.

loan.use: to buy food

loan.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORILAZO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Delia; ella tiene 30 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como gallinas, ella los hace crecer y engordar y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de gallinas. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar gallinas y alimentos para las gallinas.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Delia, age 30, lives with her partner and her two children. She is a member of the communal bank QORILAZO; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.
Delia divides her time between her daily activities and her poultry business. She grows chickens and later sells them in the Huancaro market. Delia would like to expand her chicken business and is seeking a loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loan.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loan.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El seor Ramiro y su esposa desde hace tiempo compraron un terreno, que con ahorros propios fueron construyendo lo que ahora es su casa. Ramiro es un hombre muy trabajador al igual que su esposa; esto lo hacen con el fin de ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio para el futuro. En este momento se le esta presentado una oportunidad para arreglar las escrituras de su terreno, que por circunstancias econmicas no realizaron hace aos, una oficina de localidad esta ofreciendo arreglar estos documentos a un bajo precio para que esta familia tenga todo en regla. El seor Ramiro no cuenta con el suficiente capital para aprovechar esta oferta recurre a esta institucin para pedir un apoyo y as arreglar sus documentos para que no afecten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ramiro and his wife bought a plot of land some time ago. They have been using their own savings to build what is now their home. Ramiro and his wife are very hard-working people. They did all this so that they could offer their two children a better quality of life and assets for the future.
Right now, there is an opportunity for Ramiro to sort out the deeds to his land. He did not do this years ago due to his economic circumstances. An office in town is offering to sort out these documents for him, at a low price, so that he can have everything in order. Ramiro doesn't have enough capital to take advantage of this offer. For this reason, he is requesting the support of this institution so that he can sort out the documents to ensure that he doesn't experience difficulties in the future.

loan.use: to pay to sort out the deeds to his land

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La seora Ana Mara es madre y esposa, lo cual para toda mujer es un reto sobre todo mezclarlo con el trabajo, ya que es muy difcil estar al tanto de la familia cuando se labora en una maquiladora o en alguna institucin. Por lo que Ana Mara sustituyo trabajar para una empresa, para iniciar su propio negocio donde ella pueda tomar sus propias decisiones. Desde hace 4 aos instalo una papelera y novedades llamada Doa Ana en su propio hogar donde le permitiera estar al tanto de los quehaceres del hogar y no descuidar a sus 3 pequeos que necesitan la proteccin. Ana en este momento desea comprar ms mercanca para el negocio como lo es papelera y mercera para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a su clientela y de esta manera seguir obteniendo un ingreso para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Mara is a mother and a wife which is a challenge for any woman, especially when they also work, as it is very difficult to look after your family whilst working in a maquiladora (cross-border assembly plant) or some institution. For this reason, Ana Mara decided to stop working for a company in order to set up her own business where she could make her own decisions. Four years ago, she set up a stationery and novelties store in her own home called Doa Ana. This allowed her to stay on top of her housework and not neglect her three young children who need her protection.
Right now, Ana would like to buy more merchandise for her business, such as stationery supplies and sewing supplies, so that she has a wider variety of products to offer her customers. In this way, she will be able to continue making an income to support her husband with their household expenses.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loan.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal QORILAZO; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 25 aos de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, la socia vende papa en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el prstamo para pagar deudas personales como educacin de sus hijos.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the communal bank QORILAZO; the bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.
Vicentina is 25-years-old. She lives with her partner and two children. She juggles her daily activities with her potato selling business. She sells potatoes in the streets and works from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand the potato selling business and she's requesting this loan to pay off personal debts, such as her children's education.
Vicentina is happy about the loan and she promises to make the payments.

loan.use: pay off personal debts, such as her her children's education.

loan.name: Sara

texts.es: La seora Sara es madre de 3 pequeos por lo cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace unos aos adquiri su vivienda de inters social y que le toco la fortuna que el gobierno le regalara su vivienda por lo que ahora solo le toca realizarle varias mejoras. El proyecto que desea realizar es poner techo al frente de su casa para que este mejor protegida del sol ya que en esta ciudad los temperaturas son muy altas. Sara necesita comprar material de construccin y pagar mano de obra para que su proyecto quede realizado.
texts.en: Sara is a mother of 3 small children to whom she wants to offer the best quality of life. Years ago, she acquired her home via public housing. She was lucky and the goverment gave it to her, so now she only has to make several improvements. The project she wants to do is to put a roof on the front of her house for better protection against the sun, since this city has very high temperatures. Sara needs to buy construction materials and pay for labor costs for her project to be done.

loan.use: to put a roof on the front of her house.

loan.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
Hercilia tiene 41aos de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrcola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a ms de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catlogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar ms clientes ya que mientras ms pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos y a apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economa de su hogar. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de animales (ganado ovino y caprino)
Hercilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de ms productos de belleza para exhibirlos en su domicilio, as sus clientes tendrn productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrn que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido y para lograr su objetivo ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hercilia, age 41, is married and lives together with her husband and two young children in the Olmos district -- an agricultural area with a lively commerce which is located in the Lambayeque province, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.
Hercilia makes her living selling beauty products through a catalog. She commercializes them among friends and neighbors and every day makes a great effort to attract more clients since her income depends on the volume of orders she can place for the company that provides her with the inventory. This business allows her to cover her expenses and to help her husband with the financial needs of their household. In addition, she also sells livestock (sheep and goats)
Hercilia would like to expand her business with the purchase of more inventory of beauty products that she could showcase in her home -- this way her clients will be able to get the products immediately rather than have to wait till the end of the month for the delivery of the order. To achieve this goal, Hercilia has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loan.use: to purchase beauty products

loan.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca C., 62, a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro C., a carpenter, and is the mother of six children. Three of them are already settled with their own families and the other three are working.
Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.
To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Francisca prays that her children will grow deeper in their relationship with the Lord. She also dreams that her business will become bigger and eventually turn into a convenience store. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the groups weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.
*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to pay for grocery items to expand her product inventory.

loan.name: Jos Jesus

texts.es:
Jos tiene 31 aos de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus seis hijos en el distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a ms de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Jos se dedica desde hace 4 aos a la crianza y comercializacin de ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales cra en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al pblico en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.
Jos desea ampliar su negocio comprando ms animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose, age 31, is married and lives with his wife and their six children in the Olmos district of the Lambayeque province, located about two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.
For four years, Jose has been making a living by raising and commercializing sheep and goat livestock. He raises his animals at home, and when they reach a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public as well as to the merchants who visit the area. With the income from this activity, Jose is able to provide for his family.
Jose would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed, thereby increasing his sales. For this reason, he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loan.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed

loan.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es una madre de familia de 33 aos de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el casero Paredones que se ubica a 10 minutos del distrito de Mrrope. Un distrito agrcola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a ms de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo
Lucrecia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente pavos, gallinas, patos en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos como maz, polvillo y purina, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside y en la ciudad de Chiclayo tambin negocia sus animales a los comerciantes.
Lucrecia desea adquirir ms animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 33 year old wife and mother. She is married and lives with her family in the community of Paredones, located 10 minutes from the district of Mrrope. This an agricultural district that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.
Lucrecia raises and sells small animals, especially turkeys, chickens, and ducks in a pen located in back of er house. She feed them with grains such as corn, meal and purina. when they have reached a good size, she sells them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. She also sells her animals to merchants in the city of Chiclayo.
Lucrecia wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed to grow her business and make more income. For this, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to help her achieve her goal.

loan.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loan.name: Milton Roger

texts.es:
Milton es un padre de familia de 50 aos de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia, ene le sector Las Delicias, en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Per.
El cuenta con una pequea bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por su esposa. All ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente Milton ofrece servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Estas actividades le ayudan con el sostenimiento econmico de su familia.
La creciente demanda que la bodega de Milton ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo ms productos, y agregar otros productos como tiles escolares que le permitan incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha credo conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crdito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milton is a 50-year-old father. He's married and lives with his family in the Las Delicias area, a marginal urban zone of the city of Chiclayo, a metropolitan area in the north of Per.
He owns a small general store in his home that's run by his wife. They sell a diverse array of essential products and groceries to their neighbors and customers. The business is well-appreciated. Milton also offers a taxi service in Chiclayo. These activities help him economically sustain his family.
The recent great demand for the bodega's products has made him consider expanding it by adding more products, such as school supplies, that will help him increase his sales. This is why he's requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loan.use: buy products for his general store

loan.name: Unur

texts.en:
Unur, who is 38 years old, resides with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house in the outer ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts. Unur supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, while her husband supports the family by planting cucumbers in his yard.

When Unur started her business in 2000, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian (MNT) in working capital. Today, her business has grown so that she now has 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. For the past 11 years, Unur has been selling jean trousers from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and the profits have helped sustain the family and improve their living conditions. For example, she and her husband were able to buy their own yard upon which they built their small house with their business earnings in 2010. Unur is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more jean trousers.

Unur wants to expand her stall with this loan and then be able to build their own small pickled cucumber enterprise.

loan.use: to purchase more jean trousers.

loan.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida F. is 52 years old, married, and has two working children and one child who attends high school. She is a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite City, Philippines.
At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest child to college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Adelaida, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Adelaida has had a tricycle operation (a motorcycle with a passenger cab) for six years now. She hires a driver and remits to her 150 PHP for a day.
She also manages her own tailoring business while overseeing operations of her ready-to-wear clothing business and a variety store. She mainly sells curtains, bedsheets, blankets, and other items for the home. She also provides clothing such as uniforms and does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every week from her tailoring business and variety store.
To help her continue operations of her businesses, she is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000. She will be using the loan to pay for the repair of her tricycle and to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She also plans to use the loan to buy additional grocery items as replenishment for her variety store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her businesses.
She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to pay for repair of her tricycle and additional items for her tailoring business and store.

loan.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi F. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 59 years old and married. She has six adult children.
Laxmi owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In the photo, Laxmi is shown with her husband, who operates the motorcycle.
In 2006, Laxmi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stocks and products for her store.
Laxmi is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for motorcycle repair and painting. This will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase accessories for motorcycle repair and painting.

loan.name: Lanier De Jess

texts.es: Lanier, tiene 28 aos de edad, es originario de la comunidad La Pita, ubicada en el municipio Miraflor, Estel, de oficio agricultor, esta casado tiene dos hijos, lleva 6 aos dedicndose a la siembra de hortaliza de forma independiente. Empez con ayuda de su papa a la edad de 10 aos, su padre le enseaba a preparar la tierra, pero difcil situacin econmica le impidieron seguir con sus estudios, se tuvo que dedicar tiempo completo a trabajar para poder subsistir y ayudar a su familia. Solicita el prstamo para mantenimiento, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra de siembra de tomate. Le ayudara a aumentar su produccin, sacar mejor rendimiento de su cosecha de tomate. Tiene como planes futuros ampliar su siembra de tomate, sembrar chiltoma y cebolla, le gustara poder venderlos fuera de Estel en los departamentos de Len y Managua. Su prxima meta es sembrar 3 manzanas de maz y de manzana de frijol.
texts.en:
Lanier, aged 28, lives in La Pita, a neighborhood located in the municipality of Miraflor in Estel. He is a farmer, married and the father of two children. He has been an independent vegetable farmer for six years. He began working with his father when he was 10 years old and learnt how to prepare the field. However, financial hardship prevented him from finishing his studies and he had to work full-time to survive and provide for his family.
Lanier applies for this loan to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes. It will help him increase production and get a better return on his tomato crop.
His future plan is to expand his tomato crop, and to grow sweet peppers and onions. He would like to sell them outside of Estel, namely in the departments of Len and Managua. His next goal is to plant 2 hectares of corn and 17 ares of beans (5 and 0.4 acres, respectively).

loan.use: to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes.

loan.name: ctor

texts.es: Don Ector, es originario de la comarca Santa Teresa, ubicada en el municipio de Condega- Estel, esta casado, es padre de familia de 4 hijos, de oficio productor de granos bsicos , lleva 37 aos dedicndose a esta actividad. Inicio a temprana edad tenia diez aos de edad, ayudaba a su papa a sembrar, solo llego hasta quinto grado de primaria, por su situacin de pobreza se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder llevar alimentos a su hogar, no pudo seguir estudiando. Su papa le dejo de herencia 2 metros de tierra la cuales ha venido cultivando y ha sido sustento de su familia hoy en da. Tambin dentro de su propia el tiene una pulpera donde vende granos bsicos que el mismo siembra su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio. Solicito el crdito para siembra de maz y frijoles. Con este crdito espera poder sacar una buena produccin, con granos de calidad, obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos. Le gustara poder comprar una moto para trabajo, tiene como planes futuros aumentar sus terrenos de siembra, pues desea ampliar su venta y poder convertirlo es una distribuidora de granos bsicos para abastecer de sus productos a su comunidad, y asegurarles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don ctor lives in Santa Teresa, located in the municipality of Condega-Estel. He is married and the father of four children. He has been a farmer for 37 years and grows basic grains. He began this activity at the young age of 10, helping his father with planting. He studied only until fifth grade in elementary school. Poverty forced him to work and get food on the table, and he could not continue studying. He inherited two plots of land from his father, which he has cultivated since that time to support his family. In addition, he owns a store where he sells home-grown basic grains. His wife helps him attend the store.
ctor applies for a loan to grow corn and beans. With this loan, he hopes to harvest a great amount of high-quality grains and get a good profit, enabling him to increase his income. He would like to buy a motorcycle for his work. For the future, he plans to expand his farm land and increase his sales, becoming a distributor of basic grains to his community. He wants to ensure a good future to his children.

loan.use: to grow corn and beans.

loan.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
A skilled person in manicure and pedicure is our featured entrepreneur in this story. She is Mrs. Evangeline D., 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She and her husband are blessed with four children who are all school aged.
To help her husband, Evangeline decided to engage in a manicure and pedicure business. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP 3,000 a month from her services rendered to her loyal customers and friends.
She joined PAGLAUM MPC 2 years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a fourth cycle loaner, she has requested PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing additional manicure and pedicure kits for her business.
The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that some day, all of her children will become successful in their education.

loan.use: to buy additional manicure kits for her manicure and pedicure services.

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy E. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She and her husband have six children, of whom four are already married and the rest are still single and at their adolescent stage.
The couple has been engaged in fishing as owners and operators of a fishing boat locally known as Sakayan. For over 30 years, theyve been in this kind of business to support the family. At this time they are earning an average net income of not less than PHP 4,000.
She joined PAGLAUM MPC 1 year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a second cycle loaner with a good credit record, she has requested PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies.
The future income from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs, to repay the loan and to save for the future. She is hoping that this project will yield a good catch with Gods help.

loan.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing supplies.

loan.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She is a professional expert on merchandise. She worked as expert on merchandise from 1993 to 1996.
When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers from Ereen, a border city of China. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase her jeans and trousers variety.
Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughters education.

loan.use: to increase her product variety.

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes B. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Lourdes is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver for local community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance.

loan.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta L. is from Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Loreta is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & shoes from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2011, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses.

loan.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa is 36 years old and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family does not own their apartment yet, but they have a mortgage loan from another bank in order to eventually own it. She has been on schedule with her mortgage loan payments to date. It is her familys goal to one day own their apartment.
Nyamdavaas husband is working in Korea while her daughter attends a local public school. Nyamdavaa supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia.
When she first began her business in 2002, she had 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Today she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers in her stall. With this loan of 1,000,000 MNT, Nyamdavaa will purchase stylish jeans to increase her product variety.
Her familys goal is to be secure in their own apartment.

loan.use: to purchase stylish jeans.

loan.name: Bernaliza

texts.en:
Bernaliza L. is 23 years old and married to Bryan, a contractual worker. She is a college graduate and decided to run a micro-enterprise. She is a resident of Bancal, Carmona, Cavite City, Philippines.
Bernaliza has operated their own internet cafe for two years now. She rents out computer units at a low charge per hour to all surfers, social networkers and even to students who would like to do their research on the Internet. She also offers printing job, encoding, scanning and photo printing. With this business, Bernaliza earns an estimated net income of around 350 PHP a day.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the cost of upgrading hardware and computer programs to compete with other neighboring Internet cafes. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to pay for upgrading computer programs and hardware.

loan.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is from the village of Lacas, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Estrella is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2011, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loan.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loan.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen L., 39, resident of San Isidro Labarador 1, Dasmarias, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Macario L., a vendor, and is the mother of four children, two of whom are already working, while the others are still in school. By the grace of God, Helen has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the rest of her children all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Helen, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.
Helen operates a fish stall. Fish is bought fresh from nearby ports and piers, packed in ice and then brought to the local markets. Helen and her husband clean, gut and chop fish per customer orders. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.
To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fish for their everyday inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Helen dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that her family can migrate and work in other countries in the near future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loan.use: to buy more fish fresh from ports and piers.
